0.title: ICC shares pics of moments after India's last-ball win vs Pak, says 'Etched in history'
0.article_body: The ICC took to official Twitter account of T20 World Cup 2022 to share pictures of moments after Ravichandran Ashwin scored a single on the last ball to help India beat Pakistan in their Super 12 match. "Etched in history," the ICC captioned the post. India scored 16 runs off the last over to win the match by four wickets.

1.title: Soap and oil actors leave their shoots to film for ads: Subhash Ghai
1.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai, speaking about the current generation of actors, has said that the "soap and oil" actors leave their shoots to film for advertisements. "The actors of the 90s still understand the importance of the story...today's generation wants the money to come first, they're just bothered about their personal branding and fees," he added.

2.title: Google removes apps from Play Store for performing ad fraud: Report
2.article_body: Google has removed 16 apps from Play Store which were performing ad fraud as they were impersonating a real user by clicking on ads and redirecting to web pages in the background, a security firm alleged. These apps were also causing faster battery drain and high data usage on Android devices. They had 20 million downloads before they were removed.

3.title: Kerala Governor seeks resignations of VCs of 9 universities
3.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Sunday sought the resignations of vice-chancellors of nine universities in the state. He directed the VCs that the resignations should reach him by 11.30 am on Monday. The Governor upheld a recent Supreme Court order quashing the appointment of the VCs of APJ Abdul Kalam Technological University for being contrary to UGC regulations.

4.title: Rohit Sharma lifts Virat Kohli in joy after India beat Pakistan, pics go viral
4.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma lifted Virat Kohli in joy after India defeated Pakistan on last ball in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Pictures and videos showing the same went viral on social media. In one of the videos, Rohit can be seen running towards Kohli and lifting him up, while Hardik Pandya can be seen clapping.

5.title: Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country: Sunil Chhetri
5.article_body: Indian men's football team captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli after the latter slammed 82*(53) to help India beat Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "Virat Kohli alone burst firecrackers for the entire country...Happy Diwali, India," Chhetri wrote. India completed their 160-run chase against Pakistan on the last ball.

6.title: Kohli shares pics from India vs Pak T20 World Cup match, calls it a 'Special win'
6.article_body: Virat Kohli took to Instagram to share pictures from India versus Pakistan T20 World Cup match held in Melbourne on Sunday. "Special win. Thank you to all our fans for turning up in numbers," Kohli captioned the pictures. Kohli, who smashed 82*(53) against Pakistan, said, "I rank this innings as my best."

7.title: Which states & UTs have imposed curbs on firecrackers during Diwali this year?
7.article_body: Delhi and Haryana have banned the sale, purchase and use of fireworks on Diwali, with Haryana making an exception for green firecrackers. The Punjab government has allowed the bursting of crackers during the 8 pm-10 pm window, while in Tamil Nadu crackers can be burst during two one-hour windows. Bihar also banned crackers in Patna and two other cities.

8.title: Netflix to open gaming studio, seeks to explore cloud gaming
8.article_body: Netflix has decided to open its fifth gaming studio in Southern California as it looks to seriously explore a cloud gaming offering, company's Vice President, gaming, Mike Verdu said. Verdu added that Netflix is looking at the cloud gaming service as a "value add" and not as a "console replacement". At its studios, Netflix has 14 games in full development.

9.title: Undoubtedly the best innings of your life: Sachin to Kohli on his 82*(53) vs Pakistan
9.article_body: Cricket legend Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to praise Virat Kohli for his match-winning 82*(53) against Pakistan in India's first T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "It was undoubtedly the best innings of your life. It was a treat to watch you play, the six off back foot in 19th over against Rauf over long-on was spectacular!" Sachin wrote.

10.title: Fighter jet crashes into residential building in Russia's Irkutsk
10.article_body: A Russian fighter jet crashed into a residential building in Russia's Irkutsk city on Sunday, killing both pilots, Irkutsk region's governor said. The aircraft has been identified as a Sukhoi Su-30, which officials say was on a test flight. No one on the ground was hurt, as per authorities. Another Sukhoi jet crashed in Russia's Yeysk city earlier this week.

11.title: 35-yr-old man pushed from running train by Govt Reserve Police in UP; dies
11.article_body: A 35-year-old man, Arun Bhuiyan, died after he was allegedly pushed from a moving train by Government Reserve Police (GRP) officials near Unchdih railway station in Uttar Pradesh. According to a complaint filed by Bhuiyan's friend, an argument broke out between GRP officials and Bhuiyan. The argument then led to two GRP officials throwing Bhuiyan out of the train.

12.title: Mumbai-based NGO finds banned toxic chemicals in city's firecrackers
12.article_body: A Mumbai-based NGO conducted independent tests on firecrackers in the city and claimed some of them contain banned chemicals such as arsenic, sulphur, barium and chlorine. The NGO has written to the police and Maharashtra government on the same. They also conducted a noise test on the crackers and found that they all fell within the permissible 120-decibel limit.

13.title: You freaking beauty, you've brought joy on the eve of Diwali: Anushka on Virat
13.article_body: Actress Anushka Sharma, the wife of cricketer Virat Kohli, took to Instagram to celebrate India's win over Pakistan in the T20 World Cup as Kohli smashed 82*(53). "You freaking beauty!! You've brought sooooo much joy in people's lives tonight and that too on the eve of Diwali," she said. "I've just watched the best match of my life," she added.

14.title: 3 dead, 8 injured in attack on hotel in Somalia's Kismayo
14.article_body: A blast hit a hotel in Somalia's port city of Kismayo when an explosives-laden car rammed into the hotel's gate on Sunday, following which gunfire erupted at the scene, according to police officials. At least three people were killed in the attack and eight others were injured, as per authorities. Militant group al-Shabaab has claimed responsibility for the attack.

15.title: Shivling scene in 'Baahubali' created no controversy as it was respectful: Amish
15.article_body: Author Amish Tripathi opened up about the 'Shivling' scene from SS Rajamouli's 'Baahubali: The Beginning' and said that the scene created no controversy. "It's one of the most iconic scenes in Indian cinema. It's a very respectful scene, viewers can see the intention," Amish added. In the scene, Prabhas breaks the base of 'Shivling' and carries it to the waterfall.

16.title: Banks financing Musk's Twitter deal to not sell debt to investors: Report
16.article_body: Banks providing $13 billion in financing for billionaire Elon Musk's acquisition of Twitter have abandoned plans to sell the debt to investors because of uncertainty around Twitter's fortunes and losses, Reuters reported. Banks are reportedly planning to keep the debt on their balance sheets until there's more investor interest. Debt package for the Twitter deal is comprised of junk-rated loans.

17.title: Nasdaq pauses IPOs of small Chinese firms amid stock rallies probe
17.article_body: The IPOs of at least four small Chinese companies have been put on hold by Nasdaq as it investigates the short-lived stock rallies after the debut of these firms. Nasdaq has informed lawyers and bankers that some IPOs will not proceed "until they determined what has been the aberrational trading activity in certain Chinese issuers earlier this year".

18.title: Haryana govt declares 50% VAT rebate for industrial units using natural gas
18.article_body: The Haryana government announced that it has decided to offer a 50% rebate in value-added tax to industrial units that will replace diesel generators with natural gas. The scheme will be applicable to entire industry including micro, small and medium enterprises (MSMEs). The finance committee also approved a yearly subsidy of ₹164.66 crore to EV manufacturing companies under various heads.

19.title: My heart couldn't take that anymore: Rishad Premji as India beats Pak in T20 WC
19.article_body: Taking to Twitter to congratulate Virat Kohli and the Indian Cricket Team for their win against Pakistan in the T20 World Cup, Wipro Chairman Rishad Premji said, "My heart couldn't take that anymore." India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in Melbourne. Rishad Premji further added, "Truly amazing - team India and Virat Kohli!!"

20.title: Gandhi family, its NGOs not above law: BJP on FCRA licence cancellation
20.article_body: BJP welcomed the cancellation of the FCRA licences of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation and Rajiv Gandhi Charitable Trust (RCGT) associated with the Gandhi family for allegedly violating the foreign funding law. The party said that the Gandhi family and organisations linked to it cannot be above the law. BJP spokesperson Sambit Patra claimed the action "exposed" Gandhi family's corruption.

21.title: Dr Reddy's, Cipla & Aurobindo Pharma's US-based units recall products
21.article_body: US-based unit of Dr Reddy's Laboratories is recalling 2,838 ampules of vitamin K deficiency treatment drug due to "failed stability specifications", according to the US Food and Drug Administration. Cipla is recalling 9,041 cartons of a COPD medicine due to "lack of assurance of sterility". Aurobindo Pharma's US unit is recalling 80,080 vials of injection used to control heavy bleeding.

22.title: FPIs sell Indian equities worth nearly ₹6,000 crore in October
22.article_body: The data with the depositories showed that foreign investors have sold Indian equities worth ₹5,992 crore in October (till 21) as the dollar strengthened against the rupee. The total outflow by Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) has reached ₹1.75 lakh crore so far in 2022. However, according to data, FPIs had slowed down their selling substantially during the last few days.

23.title: ICC shares graphic after Kohli helps India beat Pakistan, tweets 'The King is back'
23.article_body: After Virat Kohli's 82*(53) helped India defeat Pakistan on last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match, the official Twitter handle of ICC shared a graphic showing Kohli sitting on a throne. "The King is back...Take a bow, Virat Kohli," the ICC wrote. Kohli's innings included six fours and four sixes.

24.title: Virat Kohli punches ground, tears up after India defeat Pakistan on last ball, video viral
24.article_body: A video has gone viral showing Virat Kohli tearing up after Team India defeated Pakistan on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne on Sunday. The video also shows Kohli punching the ground after his 82*(53) helped India chase down the 160-run target. Kohli smashed six fours and four sixes in the match.

25.title: 'Adipurush' director releases new poster of Prabhas on actor's b'day
25.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut has released a new poster of actor Prabhas as Lord Ram on the occasion of the actor's 43rd birthday. Taking to Instagram, Raut shared the poster and wrote, "Maryada Purushottam Prabhu Shree Ram." Prabhas also shared the poster on his Instagram account. Recently, the film's teaser was trolled on Twitter over its VFX.

26.title: Deepawali begins: Amit Shah after India defeats Pakistan in T20 World Cup
26.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah took to Twitter on Sunday to congratulate the Indian cricket team for defeating Pakistan in the T20 World Cup match in Melbourne. "A perfect way to start the T20 World Cup...Deepawali begins," Shah tweeted. "What a cracking innings by Virat Kohli. Congratulations to the entire team," he added.

27.title: PM Modi offers prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya
27.article_body: PM Narendra Modi offered prayers to Ram Lalla at Ram Janmabhoomi in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali on Sunday. Modi arrived in Ayodhya to attend Deepotsav celebrations, during which around 18 lakh earthen lamps will be lit to celebrate Diwali. PM Modi was welcomed by Uttar Pradesh Governor Anandiben Patel and CM Yogi Adityanath.

28.title: Mobile phone suddenly explodes during repair in UP; video goes viral
28.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media which showed a mobile phone suddenly exploding while it was being repaired at a mobile shop in Uttar Pradesh's Lalitpur. Reportedly, the mobile was brought in for repair due to a problem with its charging. The shopkeeper and two others had a narrow escape in the incident.

29.title: Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman to visit India in Nov: Reports
29.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman will reportedly visit India on November 14 while on his way to the G20 summit in Bali, Indonesia. The Crown Prince is visiting India on the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and it will be a day-long visit, reports citing sources said. Last week, Saudi Energy Minister Abdulaziz bin Salman visited India.

30.title: China will open its door wider to the world: Xi Jinping
30.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping on Sunday said his country will open its door wider to the rest of the world. "China cannot develop in isolation from the world. The world's development also needs China," Xi stated. This came as Xi secured a third term as the Chinese Communist Party's head, making him the most influential party leader since Mao Zedong.

31.title: India defeat Pakistan on last ball in T20 World Cup as Virat Kohli smashes 82*(53)
31.article_body: India defeated Pakistan by four wickets on the last ball in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne on Sunday. India chased down the 160-run target as Virat Kohli smashed an unbeaten 82 off 53 deliveries. India have now won nine out of 12 T20I matches against Pakistan.

32.title: No women in China's Politburo for the first time in 25 years
32.article_body: The Chinese Communist Party's decision-making body, Politburo, will have no women members for the first time in 25 years. Sun Chunlan, the only woman sitting on the previous Politburo, has retired. China will be ruled by an all-male Politburo for the next five years as President Xi Jinping secures a historic third term in power.

33.title: Don't insult common man by calling facilities 'revdi': Kejriwal to PM
33.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal asked PM Narendra Modi to not insult the common man by calling facilities of free education and treatment as "revdi". Tweeting a report of PM Modi slamming the political culture of "revdi" or freebies, Kejriwal said, "People are quite worried due to inflation. Why should they not get free education, treatment, medicines and electricity?"

34.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan celebrates Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
34.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan celebrated Diwali eve at his residence with COVID orphans who lost their parents during the pandemic. He extended Diwali greetings to the children and was also seen dancing with them. According to the reports, 315 children were present in the programme. He planted saplings with the children before the beginning of the celebrations.

35.title: Mob thrashes suspected cattle smuggler, sets his vehicle on fire
35.article_body: A mob thrashed a man over the suspicion of smuggling cattle in West Bengal's Howrah. The mob set his vehicle, allegedly used for the act, on fire. "Locals witnessed a few cattle smugglers taking an ox in their wagon. One accused was caught and handed over to the police, while the rest are absconding," a local resident said.

36.title: Ludhiana civic body carries out trials for anti-smog guns ahead of Diwali
36.article_body: In view of rising pollution levels, the municipal corporation has begun conducting trials for anti-smog guns across different parts of Ludhiana. Attached with tractors, generator and a water tanker, the guns were taken through the city’s main roads and markets as part of the trials. Authorities said the anti-smog guns will be stationed at certain points after Diwali.

37.title: Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma to become highest run-scorer in T20I cricket
37.article_body: Former India captain Virat Kohli on Sunday overtook India captain Rohit Sharma to become the highest run-getter in T20I cricket. After scoring his first 30 runs in India's T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Kohli overtook Rohit's tally of 3,741 runs. Kohli is playing his 102nd innings in T20I cricket.

38.title: Will have low-key Diwali celebrations among family members: Randhir
38.article_body: Actor Randhir Kapoor shared that the Kapoor family will have "low-key" Diwali celebrations. "We are meeting each other...When we meet, that itself becomes a party as we're a very big family," he shared. Randhir added that the family will have a get-together at Kareena Kapoor Khan and Saif Ali Khan's house on Sunday evening.

39.title: BJP and RSS were trying to rewrite India's history: Cong MLA Abdur Rashid
39.article_body: Assam Congress MLA Abdur Rashid Mandal criticised the BJP and the RSS and alleged that both organisations were trying to rewrite the history of India. "[They] are now trying to create a fake history of the country. Everyone knows the history of India. When the BJP-RSS are rewriting India's history, it is only a history [of hate]," said Mandal.

40.title: Won’t let BJP turn K’taka into lab of hatred, misgovernance: Rahul
40.article_body: Congress won't allow Karnataka to be turned into a laboratory for BJP’s experiments with hatred and misgovernance, party leader Rahul Gandhi said. "Through untiring efforts of our state leaders, drawing on rich cultures of Karnataka and support of crores of Kannadigas, that day will soon come when we will unleash Karnataka’s true potential through the path of love...harmony," he added.

41.title: India record their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in T20I cricket history
41.article_body: India today recorded their lowest 10-over score against Pakistan in a T20I. India were restricted to 45/4 in first 10 overs by Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. India lost wickets of Rohit Sharma, KL Rahul, Suryakumar Yadav and Axar Patel within the first seven overs. India's previous lowest 10-over score in a T20I against Pakistan was 53/3.

42.title: K'taka withdraws order to collect ₹100 donation from govt school students
42.article_body: The Karnataka government has withdrawn an order to collect ₹100 as monthly donations from students to develop government primary and high schools. The order, which was issued earlier this month, has been criticised by parents and opposition parties. "After looting 40% commission from government coffers, they now want to loot from the parents too," Congress leader Siddaramaiah had said.

43.title: Hardik, Rohit get angry as spider cam denies India a potential wicket vs Pak, video viral
43.article_body: A video went viral showing India captain Rohit Sharma and all-rounder Hardik Pandya getting angry after spider cam denied India a potential wicket of Pakistan's Shan Masood in their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Masood had lofted a Ravichandran Ashwin delivery which went on to hit spider cam wire before landing in no-man's land. Masood scored 52*(42) in the innings.

44.title: Happiest Minds fires 'few' employees for moonlighting, calls it 'unacceptable'
44.article_body: Bengaluru-based IT services firm Happiest Minds Technologies fired a "few" employees who were found to be moonlighting, company executive Joseph Anantharaju told PTI. "[Moonlighting] is something we will not accept...because when you sign a contract or employment offer, you are agreeing to work only for that company," he said. Moonlighting practice is "not too pervasive" at the company, he added.

45.title: Telegram to auction usernames for 700 million users via blockchain
45.article_body: Telegram has announced that it'll auction off usernames for 700 million users on its messaging app via its blockchain-based platform. Telegram said it would use The Open Network blockchain to host the auction. "This would create a new platform where username holders could transfer them to interested parties in protected deals," said Telegram Founder Pavel Durov.

46.title: Some of us from different parties will join Bharat Jodo Yatra in Maha: Pawar
46.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said he will participate in Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra wherever possible when it enters Maharashtra. "Bharat Jodo Yatra is a Congress party programme but through this, an attempt is being made to bring harmony in society. So, some of us from different parties will join the march wherever possible when it's in Maharashtra," Pawar said.

47.title: Sonu Sood to make writing debut with action-thriller film 'Fateh'
47.article_body: Actor Sonu Sood will be making his writing debut with his upcoming action-thriller film 'Fateh'. "Personally, I have worked a lot on script and screenplay...But I'll take the credit for this for the first time," Sood said. He shared that the film revolves around the issue of digital scams for which the team has been consulting with ethical hackers.

48.title: The team deserves applause for their efforts: MP Medical Education Minister
48.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Medical Education Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang, while talking about Hindi MBBS books said "the entire...team deserves applause for their relentless efforts for over six months to make it happen". "Those raising questions on introduction of Hindi in MBBS courses should know that the system which is going to be...implemented for the first time...is a revolutionary step," he added.

49.title: 21 kg heroin seized from truck on Jammu-Srinagar highway, driver detained
49.article_body: A truck driver was detained on Sunday after 18 packets of heroin, weighing around 21.5 kg, were seized from his vehicle on Jammu-Srinagar national highway in J&K’s Udhampur. The seized contraband is worth crores of rupees in the international market, an official said. "During checking...at Zero Point on the highway at Chenani, truck coming from Kashmir…was intercepted," the official stated.

50.title: RSS leader pays visit to Delhi's Nizamuddin Dargah ahead of Diwali
50.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar visited Hazrat Nizamuddin Dargah in New Delhi and lit earthen lamps inside the premises of the shrine. "The festival of Diwali is celebrated in the world, including India...This festival erases all the religious differences...Everyone should follow their own religion and caste. Do not criticise and insult others' religions," said Kumar.

51.title: Pune man tries stealing power for Diwali stall, dies
51.article_body: While attempting to steal electricity for a Diwali stall set up by a woman in Aundh, a Pune man died of electrocution. The deceased, identified as Pravin Ashok Mane, tried to steal electricity from a Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) feeder pillar. The woman and the deceased were booked under IPC and the Electricity Act.

52.title: Delhi records 'poor' air quality for 8th straight day ahead of Diwali
52.article_body: The air quality in Delhi was recorded in the 'poor' category for the eighth consecutive day on Sunday as smog engulfed Delhi and neighbouring areas. The overall AQI in Delhi was recorded at 243 at 10 am on Sunday. It was around 265 on Saturday evening. The air quality is likely to deteriorate in the coming days.

53.title: Gurugram records 2nd highest number of dengue cases in last 7 yrs
53.article_body: After four new dengue cases were reported in Gurugram on Saturday, the district took its total tally of cases to 337 for this year, while 327 cases were reported last year. This is the second-highest number of dengue cases recorded in the district in the last seven years. The worst-hit areas have been Wazirabad, Farrukhnagar, Pataudi and Ghangola, among others.

54.title: 2 more people test positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala
54.article_body: Uganda's Health Ministry on Sunday said two more people, who were admitted in an isolation unit of the country's main hospital in the capital city of Kampala, had tested positive for Ebola. On Saturday, the ministry reported three confirmed cases from the same hospital. The five confirmed cases are the first known transmission of the virus in Kampala.

55.title: Robbie Coltrane's death certificate reveals multiple causes including sepsis & diabetes
55.article_body: Actor Robbie Coltrane, who passed away recently, died from a series of conditions including multiple organ failure, sepsis, lower respiratory tract infection and heart block. According to his death certificate, the actor also suffered from diabetes and obesity. Coltrane, who was famous for his role as Rubeus Hagrid in 'Harry Potter' films, had been unwell for some time.

56.title: Interpol launches world's first global police Metaverse
56.article_body: International crime control organisation Interpol has launched the world's first global police Metaverse for law enforcement officials to increase cooperation. Users of this Metaverse can interact with each other and even take training courses on forensic investigation and other policing capabilities. Interpol will also create an expert group to represent officials' views on security in Metaverse.

57.title: Shameless man should be sacked: Jairam after K’taka minister slaps woman
57.article_body: After a video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman during a public event was widely shared online, Congress’ Jairam Ramesh tweeted, "This shameless man should be sacked immediately!" Furthermore, he said, "What a difference from the way Rahul Gandhi began the Karnataka leg of Bharat Jodo Yatra from the very same Gundlupet on 30th September!"

58.title: Kheda caning victims file case against police officers in Gujarat HC
58.article_body: The Gujarat High Court issued a notice to 15 police personnel allegedly involved in the public flogging of Muslim men in Kheda district earlier this month. The five victims who filed the case were accused of pelting stones during a garba event. They also claimed that the police violated Supreme Court's directions on how to deal with people in custody.

59.title: Palestinian group says its member killed by Israel in 'targeted explosion'
59.article_body: A senior member of the Palestinian militant group "Den of Lions" was killed overnight on Sunday in a "targeted explosion" carried out by Israel, according to the group. Tamer Kilani was killed in West Bank's Nablus city when a bomb placed on a motorcycle parked nearby was detonated, the group informed. The Israeli military declined to comment on the explosion.

60.title: Haven't seen a film like this: Vivek Agnihotri on 'Kantara'
60.article_body: Director Vivek Agnihotri said he hasn't seen a film like 'Kantara', which he called Rishab Shetty's "masterpiece" and a film that is "full of art and folklore". "One of the finest films I have seen in a long time. Congratulations Rishab for making wonderful cinema...great cinematography," he said. Earlier, Kangana Ranaut, Ram Gopal Varma and others also praised the film.

61.title: I hate it, I'm disgusted with such people: Jaya Bachchan on media persons
61.article_body: Speaking about media persons, Jaya Bachchan said they sell products by invading people's personal space. "I hate it, I'm disgusted with such people. I always tell them, I say, 'Aapko sharam nahi aati hai?' (Don't you feel ashamed?)," she added. "I despise the people who interfere in your personal life...fill their stomachs by selling those products," Jaya stated.

62.title: Pune will get 7 new police stations: Chandrakant Patil
62.article_body: District Guardian Minister Chandrakant Patil said that Pune will get seven new police stations in the city after he conducted a meeting with police officials. Patil also stated that steps will be taken to address shortage of manpower in the city police. The police stations will come up at Wagholi, Kharadi, Phursungi, Baner, Nanded City, Kale Padal and Ambegaon.

63.title: MP bans firecrackers in Gwalior, Singrauli and Katni due to poor air quality
63.article_body:
Madhya Pradesh government has banned firecrackers in Gwalior, Singrauli and Katni districts due to poor Air Quality Index (AQI). The government issued a notice that states green crackers can be burst from 8 pm to 10 pm only in those cities where the air quality is medium or below category. 
A letter has been written to the local district collectors.

64.title: Suresh Raina's 'Arshdeep will dismiss Babar' prediction comes true, fans react
64.article_body: After India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam for a golden duck in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday, fans reacted to Suresh Raina's two-day-old prediction coming true. One of the fans wrote, "Einstein of palmistry?" "Very Prophetic. Are you the new Jofra Archer?" wrote another fan.

65.title: Hardik Pandya smiles at Pakistan's Haider Ali after dismissing him, pic goes viral
65.article_body: Team India all-rounder Hardik Pandya smiled at Pakistan's Haider Ali after dismissing him in their T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. Haider Ali was dismissed on the last ball of the 14th over after being caught in the deep by Suryakumar Yadav. Hardik Pandya registered bowling figures of 4-0-30-3 in the match.

66.title: Amit Shah congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 satellites
66.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah lauded the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) for the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites and called it a landmark day for India's space programme. "India stepped into a new era of self-reliance with the successful launch of its heaviest rocket, LVM3...Congratulations to our scientists and the entire team," said Shah.

67.title: Hyd police, narcotics wing arrest 3 persons, seize 40 gm cocaine
67.article_body: Panjagutta Police and Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing have arrested a Nigerian man and two others for allegedly peddling drugs, Hyderabad City Police said on Saturday. Police added that 40 gm of cocaine and eight phones worth a total of ₹5 lakh were also seized. So far, five people who're purchasing drugs from the accused have been identified, police further said.

68.title: Man hacked to death after wife beats her harassers with sandals in B'luru
68.article_body: After a woman hit her harassers with sandals after being told to do so in Bengaluru, her husband was hacked to death. Preliminary investigations revealed that the husband was killed as revenge. The deceased, a 33-year-old man, was hacked to death while he was standing on the terrace of his house, reports said.

69.title: Gurugram Police arrest 3 men for cheating in Delhi Police Examination
69.article_body: Gurugram Police arrested three people, including the manager of a multinational firm and a scholar, for allegedly cheating in the Delhi Police Examination 2022. The accused have been identified as Tarun Shukla, Jaiveer Kumar and Lalit Yadav. Notably, Shukla helped Kumar enter the test centre illegally in order to write the exam for Yadav, police said.

70.title: 8 of top 10 most valued firms add ₹2 lakh cr to m-cap; RIL top gainer
70.article_body: Market capitalisation (m-cap) of eight of top 10 most valued firms rose by ₹2.03 lakh crore  as Sensex rose 1,466.46 points, or 2.54%, over the last week. Top gainer Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) m-cap rose ₹68,296.41 crore to ₹16.72 lakh crore. RIL was followed by SBI, which added ₹30,120.57 crore, and ICICI Bank, which added ₹25,946.89 crore to its m-cap.

71.title: Rishi Sunak declares he's running to become the UK's next PM
71.article_body: Indian-origin Rishi Sunak on Sunday formally declared that he's running to become the UK's next Prime Minister. "I want to fix our economy, unite our Party and deliver for our country," Sunak tweeted. This comes after Liz Truss resigned as the UK's PM 45 days after taking over the role.

72.title: ICICI Bank reappoints Sandeep Bakhshi as MD, CEO for 3 years
72.article_body: The board of directors of ICICI Bank has re-appointed Sandeep Bakhshi as the managing director (MD) and chief executive officer (CEO) of the bank for the next three years. The current tenure of Bakhshi was until October 3, 2023. Bakhshi's reappointment will be subject to the approval of the RBI and the shareholders of the bank.

73.title: 306 madrassas, including Darul Uloom, declared illegal in UP’s Saharanpur
73.article_body: The Saharanpur administration has declared 306 Islamic educational institutions as illegal, including Deoband's Darul Uloom, after a survey was conducted by the authorities. "An investigation was [conducted] on the basis of parameters set by the administration like the year of establishment of the madrassa, the society that runs it...and their source of income," an officer said.

74.title: Police seize ₹63 lakh hawala money in Hyderabad, 5 arrested
74.article_body: The Commissioner’s Task Force, in coordination with the Central Zone Police, busted a hawala racket on Sunday in Hyderabad's Troop Bazar and arrested five persons. The police seized cash worth ₹63,50,000 along with a two-wheeler, five mobile phones and a cashier machine. The police caught the accused while raiding an electrical godown at Ranuja Marketing.

75.title: Assam government hikes DA by 4% for employees
75.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma, on Twitter, announced an additional dearness allowance (DA) of 4% for all government employees and all India service officers as a festival gift. He said the additional DA will be effective from July 1, and the additional amount will be paid with October's salary. It will increase the DA of the employees to 35%.

76.title: Representation matters: Priyanka on Diwali holiday in NYC schools
76.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra has reacted to the news of Diwali being announced as a public school holiday in New York City from 2023 onwards. "After all these years! My teenage self living in Queens is crying tears of joy. Representation matters," she wrote on Instagram. On the work front, Priyanka's next Bollywood project is 'Jee Le Zaraa'.

77.title: Adopt stray dogs, take them home if you want to feed them: Bombay HC
77.article_body: Bombay High Court's Nagpur Bench has said, "If any person is interested in feeding stray dogs, he shall first adopt the stray dog/bitch, bring it to home, register it with Municipal Authorities or put it in some dogs shelter." It also directed Nagpur civic body to impose up to ₹200 fine on people feeding stray dogs in public places.

78.title: Mandy Moore welcomes second child with husband Taylor, shares pics
78.article_body: Actress Mandy Moore and her husband Taylor Goldsmith welcomed their second child. On October 22, Moore shared some pictures on Instagram and introduced her newborn baby boy as Oscar Bennett Goldsmith. "Our hearts have doubled in size and the immediacy of the love is astounding. He is beyond words and we're so grateful for our family of four," she wrote.

79.title: New data transmission record set using a single light source
79.article_body: An international group of researchers from the Technical University of Denmark (DTU) and the Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, Sweden have set a new data transmission record of 1.8 petabits per second. The record data transmission speed was achieved using only a single laser and an optical chip. Notably, 1 petabit corresponds to 1 million gigabits.

80.title: Student run over by bus at Bangalore University succumbs to injuries
80.article_body: The 23-year-old student, who was run over by a Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation bus at Bangalore University's Jnana Bharati campus, has succumbed to her injuries, 13 days after the accident. She had slipped while boarding the bus and was crushed under its rear wheel on October 10. Following the accident, students blocked the campus' gates and prevented vehicles from entering.

81.title: Plane carrying Gold's Gym owner & family crashes near Costa Rica; all 6 feared dead
81.article_body: A plane carrying businessman Rainer Schaller, who owns fitness and gym outlets like Gold's Gym and McFit, crashed into the Caribbean just off the Costa Rican coast. Piloted by a Swiss national, Schaller was travelling with his partner, Christiane Schikorsky, their two children and a fitness trainer. According to authorities, all six people are feared dead.

82.title: Ferrari hits railing on Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link; no one hurt
82.article_body: A speeding Ferrari rammed into the railing on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link in Mumbai, police said. The car reportedly belongs to an industrialist. The police added that no one was injured in the incident. "The car was speeding and we suspect it was about to race on the Sea Link but...it veered out of control," a police official said.

83.title: B'luru cab drivers create groups on Telegram to connect with customers
83.article_body: Cab drivers in Bengaluru have created multiple groups on Telegram to stay connected with customers amid ongoing discussions between the Karnataka government and app-based cab aggregators like Ola and Uber. Drivers reportedly add customers they meet on a daily basis to the groups. Customers can ask for a cab in the group and the nearest driver interacts with them directly.

84.title: 2 killed as fire breaks out in Andhra Pradesh cracker shops, video surfaces
84.article_body: Two people were killed after a fire broke out at a cluster of cracker shops in Andhra Pradesh. Police said that the incident took place when the crackers were being unloaded from a van. A video of the burning shops surfaced online. An official statement said that the actual reason behind the fire is being ascertained.

85.title: Rohit Sharma gets emotional during National Anthem ahead of Pakistan match, video viral
85.article_body: Team India captain Rohit Sharma got emotional during the National Anthem ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan in Melbourne. A video of the same has gone viral. In the video, Rohit can be seen trying to fight back tears. The ICC also shared the video on Instagram, writing, "The emotions are real!"

86.title: Arshdeep dismisses Babar Azam for golden duck on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery
86.article_body: Team India fast bowler Arshdeep Singh dismissed Pakistan captain Babar Azam on his first-ever T20 World Cup delivery. The 23-year-old pacer, who is India's youngest member at T20 World Cup 2022, dismissed Babar LBW with an inswinging delivery. Babar opted for a review but the third umpire confirmed his dismissal.

87.title: Cong's Bharat Jodo Yatra enters T'gana after completing its K'taka leg
87.article_body: Congress’ Bharat Jodo Yatra entered Telangana on Sunday after completing its Karnataka leg. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi was accorded a grand welcome at the Telangana-Karnataka border by Telangana Congress leaders. After entering Gudeballur, the yatra halted for a break on the occasion of Diwali. It will resume from there on the morning of October 27.

88.title: Man sitting inside car dies as gas cylinder fitted in vehicle explodes in TN
88.article_body: A person who was sitting inside a car in Tamil Nadu's Coimbatore died after a gas cylinder that was fitted inside the vehicle exploded. The identity of the person is yet to be ascertained. Police said that the process of collecting evidence is on. Security has been tightened in the area following the incident.

89.title: I've switched off TV, doused myself with anti-jinx spray: Mahindra on India-Pak match
89.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra said that he has doused himself with "anti-jinx spray" ahead of India-Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 match on Sunday. "As always, I am ready for the...match...[I] have my anti-stress ball and worry beads at my side. And my TV set firmly switched off," he tweeted. Mahindra joked that he'll now only wait for news of the result.

90.title: Burn under control now: CEO on report of Unacademy's losses jumping 85% in FY22
90.article_body: Reacting to a report on Unacademy's losses jumping 85% from ₹1,537 crore in FY21 to ₹2,848 crore in FY22 due to high ESOP costs, CEO Gaurav Munjal tweeted, "We spent a lot in FY22 to gain market share. Burn is under control now." Earlier, a report said Unacademy has cut its monthly expenditure to ₹50-60 crore from over ₹200 crore.

91.title: Flying car prototype worth ₹2.5 crore whose sides become wings unveiled in US
91.article_body: American startup Alef Aeronautics has unveiled a flying car prototype costing $300,000 (about ₹2.5 crore). The car features a body that flips on its side to become the wings after lift-off and mesh on its top surface to let air flow through. It can be driven on a regular street and is capable of vertical take off and landing.

92.title: Jennifer Aniston reached out the most: Perry on his substance abuse
92.article_body: Actor Matthew Perry said his 'Friends' co-star Jennifer Aniston had confronted him about his alcohol and drug abuse, and often reached out to him. "She was the one who reached out the most. I'm really grateful to her for that," he said. Perry recalled taking 55 Vicodin a day during 'Friends' and admitted that he "didn't know how to stop".

93.title: Amitabh Bachchan reveals he cut a vein on his left calf, was rushed to hospital
93.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan has said that he was recently rushed to a hospital after he cut a vein on his left calf. "A jutting piece of metal sliced my left calf and managed to cut the vein...the vein when cut spurts out the 'red' uncontrollably," he wrote in his blog. He added that he received stitches to control the bleeding.

94.title: Pak have better quality in death overs: Hogg on T20 WC match vs India
94.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Pakistan "definitely" have better quality in their bowling department in the death overs in comparison to India, ahead of the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides. "When it comes to middle overs, India have better spinners than...Pakistan...They have spinners who can pick up wickets but also nullify the run-rate," added Hogg.

95.title: Congress suspends rape accused Kerala MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly
95.article_body: The Congress in Kerala suspended rape accused MLA Eldhose Kunnappilly for six months. "The explanation provided by him on the allegations was not satisfactory. As a representative of the people, he failed to exercise due diligence," the Kerala Pradesh Congress Committee said. A woman had recently filed a rape and attempt to murder case against him.

96.title: Top marketing officer sexually harasses ex-staffer in Mumbai; booked
96.article_body: The Chief Marketing Officer (CMO) of a leading financial company was booked for allegedly sexually harassing a former female employee in Mumbai. The woman claimed that the accused had also threatened to fire her when she refused his sexual advances, according to police. The woman was reportedly fired after the HR department gave clean chit to the accused in 2020.

97.title: Video of 4 men offering namaz inside train in UP surfaces, Railway police launches probe
97.article_body: A video of four men offering namaz inside a train stationed near the Khadda railway station in Uttar Pradesh’s Kushinagar has surfaced on social media. The video was shared by former BJP MLA from Kushinagar Deeplal Bharati. Meanwhile, the Railway police said it has launched a probe into the matter though no FIR has been filed.

98.title: 70-yr-old retired police officer dies after fire engulfs house in Lucknow
98.article_body: A 70-year-old retired Inspector General (IG) of Police died while his wife and son were injured when a fire broke out in their house in Lucknow’s Indira Nagar on Saturday, police said. The fire broke out on the first floor of retired IG DC Pandey’s residence, trapping him and his family. A detailed probe is underway into the matter.

99.title: Helicopter narrowly misses vehicles on Ukraine road; video surfaces
99.article_body: Ukraine's Defense Ministry has shared a video which shows a helicopter narrowly missing vehicles on a road in the country, with the caption, "Welcome to Ukraine." A Twitter user reacted to the video, saying, "Below the radar has a new meaning," while another user tweeted, "Not your typical way to commute to work, but everyone has a job to do."

100.title: India announce their playing XI for T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan
100.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to field first against Pakistan in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Melbourne. India have left out Deepak Hooda, Rishabh Pant, Yuzvendra Chahal and Harshal Patel from the playing XI. Mohammad Shami, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh are the three main fast bowlers in India's playing XI.

101.title: All your pain goes away when you take the field against Pak: Sehwag
101.article_body: Sharing his experience while facing Pakistan, ahead of India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Virender Sehwag said, "No matter how much pain you're in, it...goes away when you take the field against them." Discussing the T20 World Cup 2022 match between the sides, Sehwag stated, "It's a big ground...Be very sure before sending the ball over the boundary."

102.title: What is India's record against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
102.article_body: India and Pakistan have played 11 T20Is against each other, with India winning eight times, including one through a bowl out. India have lost two of their last three T20I matches against Pakistan, including a 10-wicket defeat in T20 World Cup 2021. The T20 World Cup 2022 match will be India-Pakistan's first encounter against each other in Australia.

103.title: Minister slaps woman, she touches his feet in Karnataka; video surfaces
103.article_body: A video of Karnataka Minister V Somanna slapping a woman in Chamarajanagar district during a public event to distribute land title deeds is being widely shared online. The woman could be seen touching the minister's feet after he slaps her. The woman, Kempamma, came to the venue and claimed the selection process for beneficiaries was rigged.

104.title: Pune court grants Father Vincent Pereira bail in the POCSO case
104.article_body: A Pune court on Friday granted bail to Father Vincent Pereira, who was booked under the Protection of Children from Sexual Offences Act (POCSO) for alleged sexual abuse of a 15-year-old boy. The FIR stated that Father Pereira sexually abused the minor boy while two other prominent members of the church allegedly did not act against him.

105.title: Which Indians have smashed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket?
105.article_body: Among Indians, Yuvraj Singh has slammed the most number of sixes against Pakistan in T20I cricket. He slammed nine maximums in eight innings against Pakistan. He is followed by Virat Kohli (seven), Rohit Sharma (six) and Gautam Gambhir (three). Meanwhile, among Pakistanis, Muhammad Rizwan has slammed the most sixes against India in T20I cricket, with six maximums.

106.title: UP woman raped by stepson, husband's colleagues writes to Prez seeking euthanasia
106.article_body: A 30-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh, allegedly raped by her stepson and gang-raped by her husband's colleagues, has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu seeking euthanasia. She wrote, "I've lost all my hope in justice. Despite the court's order, police haven't arrested any of the accused." The woman got married to a 55-year-old farmer, three years after her divorce.

107.title: My father tore govt job letter, started Cycle Agarbathies with ₹4,000: Ranga Rao's son
107.article_body: N Ranga Rao, the Founder of Cycle Brand Agarbathies, started his incense business by borrowing ₹4,000 in 1948 after pawning his wife's jewellery. Ranga Rao applied for a central government job after failing in trading and dairy farming, his son Mohan Rangarao revealed. However, he tore up the appointment letter and pursued his dream of becoming an entrepreneur, he added.

108.title: Odisha family says pet dog died due to negligence, FIR filed against doctor
108.article_body: An FIR was filed against a veterinary doctor after a family alleged that their pet dog Dugu died due to negligence of the doctor in Odisha. The dog died on October 17. The family kept his body for four days, hoping for postmortem to find exact cause of his death. The dog died after being brought home from the hospital.

109.title: Audience holds 'Vande Mataram' flags at RRR's Japan screening, makers react
109.article_body: 'RRR' makers on Saturday shared a video in which the Japanese audience was seen holding flags with 'Vande Mataram' written over them. The makers tweeted, "Proud moment for us to see the Vande Mataram flag in the hands of the Japanese and their love towards India at the screening of 'RRR'." The film had its Japan premiere on October 21.

110.title: No player might've faced such pressure: Ajay Jadeja on India-Pak T20 WC match
110.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Ajay Jadeja said "no player" might have experienced similar pressure as that set to be experienced by players featuring in the T20 World Cup 2022 match between India and Pakistan. "I doubt we will ever witness a larger crowd than this for an India-Pakistan contest," added Ajay. "India are the better side...There is absolutely no doubt," he stated.

111.title: This Pakistani team is very challenging: Rohit ahead of T20 WC 2022 match
111.article_body: Discussing India's T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "This Pakistani team is...very challenging...They've been playing good cricket." "All the Pakistan teams I've played...from 2007 to 2022, they've been...good teams," added Rohit. Sharing his approach for the match, Rohit stated, "When we enter the ground...I'll be focused on...[putting] the opposition under pressure."

112.title: Pakistan have the best bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
112.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling attack in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they've just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

113.title: US girl steals $13,500 from grandmother, gives it to classmates
113.article_body: A 14-year-old girl is facing a grand theft charge after she allegedly stole $13,500 from her grandmother's safe and handed out over $10,000 to her classmates in US' Florida. Officials have recovered about $2,500 from the girl's backpack and around $700 from other students at her school. The arrest report does not mention the reason behind the incident.

114.title: Pakistan have the best bowling in T20 World Cup 2022: Gambhir
114.article_body: Gautam Gambhir said Pakistan have the "best" bowling in T20 World Cup 2022. "If you look at Australia, they have just one bowler who can bowl over 140 kmph. For England, Mark Wood can bowl over 150 kmph," added Gambhir. "For Pakistan, Shaheen Afridi, Haris Rauf and Naseem Shah...can bowl over 140 kmph. Fast bowling is their strength," he stated.

115.title: Plane crashes into building in New Hampshire; 2 on board plane dead
115.article_body: Two people who were on board a small plane died after it crashed into a building in Keene in US' New Hampshire, authorities said. Eight people who were living in an apartment building, connected to the building hit by the plane, were evacuated after a fire broke out. The cause of crash remains under investigation, Keene Mayor George Hansel said.

116.title: PM Modi congratulates ISRO on successful launch of 36 OneWeb satellites
116.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) on the successful launch of its heaviest rocket with 36 OneWeb satellites. "Congratulations...on the successful launch of our heaviest launch vehicle LVM3 with 36 OneWeb satellites...LVM3 exemplifies Atmanirbharta...and enhances India's competitive edge in global commercial launch service market," he tweeted.

117.title: 4 men tie up & gangrape 32-yr-old nurse at health centre in Chhattisgarh, record act
117.article_body: Four men allegedly tied up and gangraped a 32-year-old nurse who was working alone at a health centre in Chhattisgarh's Manendragarh district. The nurse alleged that the accused recorded the assault and threatened to murder her if she went to the police. Police have arrested three of the accused, including a 17-year-old boy.

118.title: PM constantly sought to create new avenues for jobs for youth: Union Minister
118.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has constantly sought to create new avenues and opportunities for livelihood, income and government jobs for the country’s youth, Union Minister Jitendra Singh said on Saturday. Furthermore, Singh said that right from the beginning, the Prime Minister has given the highest priority to the issues related to the youth.

119.title: Balenciaga, Vogue cut ties with Kanye West over his anti-Semitic comments
119.article_body: Fashion house Balenciaga and fashion magazine Vogue have announced that they'll no longer work with Kanye West. The announcement has come weeks after West's anti-Semitic remarks. "Balenciaga has no longer any relationship nor any plans for future projects related to this artist," the brand's parent company said in a statement. West made his modelling debut at Balenciaga's 2023 show.

120.title: 30-yr-old labourer returning to Bihar dies after cough bout at Pune station
120.article_body: A 30-year-old labourer who was returning to his home in Bihar died after he suffered a bout of cough at Pune Railway Station. The Government Railway Police have denied that the man died during a stampede at the railway station amid a huge rush of people heading home for Diwali. Police said the man was unwell, according to primary investigations.

121.title: Suryakumar Yadav, Babar Azam rate their own skills out of 100
121.article_body: The ICC has shared videos of Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav and Pakistan captain Babar Azam rating their skills out of 100. Suryakumar rated his power 90, stroke range 93, spin-playing skills 95, pace-playing skills 93 and his fielding 90. Meanwhile, Babar rated his power 70, stroke range 80, spin-playing skills 75, pace-playing skills 90 and his fielding 60.

122.title: Actors of 90s like SRK or Aamir still understand story's importance: Ghai
122.article_body: Director Subhash Ghai said that the actors of 90s, such as Shah Rukh Khan, Salman Khan or Aamir Khan, "still understand the importance of" a film's story, but today's generation of actors "wants the money to come first". Ghai said, "They are just bothered about their personal branding and fees; they feel they have become big brands."

123.title: 5 charged after US daycare worker scared kids with Halloween mask
123.article_body: After a video surfaced of a daycare worker scaring children while wearing a Halloween mask in US' Mississippi, four people linked to the video are facing child abuse charges while a fifth person is facing two misdemeanour counts, authorities said. The video showed children crying and running from the masked worker. The owner of the daycare isn't facing any charges.

124.title: US VP Kamala Harris hosts Diwali celebrations in Washington, videos surface
124.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris hosted Diwali celebrations at her official residence, the Naval Observatory, on Friday. Some videos that surfaced on social media from the event showed her lighting sparklers along with her husband and Second Gentleman, Doug Emhoff, and wishing each other 'Happy Diwali'. Several prominent Indian Americans were present at the event.

125.title: K'taka Deputy Speaker Anand Mamani passes away at 56, CM pays tribute
125.article_body: The Deputy Speaker of Karnataka, Anand Mamani (56), passed away late Saturday night in the Manipal Hospital in Bengaluru. He was battling ill health for more than a month. Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai paid tribute to his party colleague and said, "I pray that God rest his soul in eternal peace and give his family strength to bear this pain."

126.title: Army Chief, his wife visit Army Base Hospital in Delhi
126.article_body: Chief of Army staff General Manoj Pande and his wife Archana Pande visited the Base Hospital, Delhi Cantt on Saturday and interacted with the serving soldiers and their families. He also lauded the efforts of paramedics for ensuring a conducive healthcare ecosystem. He took over as the new Chief of Army Staff from General Manoj Mukund Naravane on April 30.

127.title: 8 drug peddlers transporting 480 kg ganja held: Rachakonda Police
127.article_body: Rachakonda Police tweeted on Saturday that eight inter-state drug peddlers who were transporting 480 kg of ganja were arrested by Hayathnagar police. The accused were transporting ganja, which they would sell for ₹20,000 per kg, from Andhra Pradesh's Visakhapatnam to Hyderabad and Karnataka, the police said. The accused were detained under the Preventive Detention Act, the police added.

128.title: Rohit Sharma dons mic while practising in nets, ICC shares video
128.article_body: The ICC has shared a video of India captain Rohit Sharma practising in the nets while donning a mic. In the video, Rohit can be heard calling Shami "most dangerous" bowler. "You're swinging the ball very late. I can see everything," he was also heard telling a bowler. He was also seen praising Dinesh Karthik for one of his shots.

129.title: Not here to have a nice and easy time or build a 'me too' company: Ola CEO
129.article_body: Ola CEO Bhavish Aggarwal at the company's recent launch event said, "We're not here to build a 'me too' company, we're not here to have a nice and easy time." Addressing allegations of a "hostile" work culture at Ola, Aggarwal said, "We are a very ambitious company." Ola has a culture of high quality and high execution, the 37-year-old added.

130.title: Video shows launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 satellites on board
130.article_body: OneWeb has shared a video showing the launch of ISRO's heaviest rocket carrying the startup's 36 broadband satellites on board. The LVM3 rocket lifted off from the Sriharikota spaceport just after midnight, marking its first commercial satellite launch. At 1.42 am on Sunday, the ISRO confirmed that the mission was completed successfully, with all 36 satellites placed into intended orbits.

131.title: 4 die, over 40 injured as bus meets with accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway
131.article_body: Four people were killed while about 42 people were injured after a sleeper bus met with an accident on Agra-Lucknow Expressway. The sleeper bus was en route to Ajmer from Gorakhpur. "While praying for peace for the soul of the departed, the Chief Minister has expressed condolences to the bereaved families," a tweet from the CM Office read.

132.title: India reports 1,994 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 23,432
132.article_body: India reported 1,994 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,112 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases now stand at 23,432. The data showed that 2,601 people recovered in the last 24 hours. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,961.

133.title: Chinese President Xi Jinping secures historic 3rd term in power
133.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping has secured a historic third five-year term after he was elected to the Central Committee by the ruling Communist Party on Saturday, making him the nation's most influential leader since founder Mao Zedong. "I wish to thank the whole Party sincerely for the trust you have placed in us," Jinping told journalists on Sunday.

134.title: 27-year-old drug peddler arrested in Hyderabad, 30 gm of MDMA seized
134.article_body: A 27-year-old man, who was allegedly in possession of MDMA, was arrested by the Hyderabad Narcotic Enforcement Wing (H-NEW) in coordination with the Golconda Police. The police seized 30 grams of MDMA, a phone and ₹3,000 cash from the accused, a native of UP. He purportedly purchased psychotropic drugs from dealers and supplied them to consumers in Mumbai and Hyderabad.

135.title: They wouldn't cast me as lead because I'm fat: Maanvi on being body shamed
135.article_body: Actress Maanvi Gagroo opened up about being body shamed in the film industry and said that people didn't want to cast her as the lead of their projects because she was fat. "They didn't know what category to fit me in," she said. Maanvi added that she's yet to accept herself and believe that she's perfect as she is.

136.title: Potential explosive device found at Toronto airport; 2 detained
136.article_body: Two people have been detained after a potential explosive device was found near the ferry terminal of Billy Bishop Airport in Canada's Toronto on Saturday. Passengers were evacuated from the airport and flight operations were suspended while the police conducted an investigation. Later, the airport tweeted that the police have concluded the investigation and the device has been disarmed.

137.title: Team India should cut down Babar's singles, bowl straight: Brett Lee
137.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee said Team India should bowl "nice and straight" to Babar Azam in their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. "Cut down the singles...That's the best way to trouble him," added Lee. Talking about Rohit Sharma, Lee stated, "[He]...must...stay in as long as he possibly can...The longer he stays in, the more worried Pakistan will become."

138.title: Thousands gather in Germany in solidarity with protesters in Iran
138.article_body: Tens of thousands of people gathered in Germany's capital city Berlin on Saturday in solidarity with protesters in Iran. People were seen carrying signs which criticised Iranian leaders and had taglines like 'Women, Life, Freedom'. Protests have erupted in Iran after 22-year-old Mahsa Amini died in the custody of morality police after allegedly being detained over "improper hijab".

139.title: Guardian Minister to review development projects in Pune Zilla Parishad
139.article_body: Pune Guardian Minister Chandrakant Patil will be reviewing developmental projects in Pune Zilla Parishad sanctioned by the previous Maha Vikas Aghadi (MVA) government. "Many developmental [projects] in Pune ZP were approved in a hurry in the past. As per the new government resolution, we have decided to scrutinise every work approved by the previous government," said Patil.

140.title: Asked to get jewellery from parents' home, Telangana woman kills husband
140.article_body: A woman killed her husband using a brick in Telangana after he asked her to bring jewellery from her parents' home. Reports said that she hit the man with a brick in a fit of rage. The man sustained injury on his head and died on the spot. The woman surrendered before the police after killing her husband.

141.title: Govt cancels FCRA licence of Rajiv Gandhi Foundation: Reports
141.article_body: The Centre has cancelled the FCRA licence of the Rajiv Gandhi Foundation (RGF), a non-government organisation associated with the Gandhi family, for allegedly violating the foreign funding law, as per officials. The decision was reportedly taken on the basis of investigations carried out by an inter-ministerial committee formed by the Ministry of Home Affairs in July 2020.

142.title: Who won Player of the Match awards in previous India-Pakistan T20 WC matches?
142.article_body: Shaheen Afridi was named Player of the Match in India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2021 match. Mohammad Asif won the award for taking four wickets in the first-ever India-Pakistan T20 World Cup encounter in 2007. Irfan Pathan won it in final of 2007 edition, while Amit Mishra bagged it in 2014. Virat Kohli won the award in 2012 and 2016 editions.

143.title: Sourav Ganguly names his semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022
143.article_body: Former Team India captain Sourav Ganguly has named four teams which according to him will be the semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022. Ganguly stated that India, South Africa, Australia and England will reach the last four stage of the tournament. "India will be one of the favourites to win the tournament," he added.

144.title: Conman Sukesh releases letter, says 'Jacqueline never asked me for anything except love'
144.article_body: Sukesh Chandrashekhar, the main accused in ₹200-crore extortion case, has released a letter through his lawyer mentioning that it's "very unfortunate" that Jacqueline Fernandez has been named an accused in the case. "We were in a relationship and if I have given her and her family gifts, what's their fault...She never asked me for anything except loving her," he wrote.

145.title: BJP MP launches Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council for students
145.article_body: BJP MP Tejasvi Surya launched the Bengaluru South School Leaders' Council, comprising school leaders who will be responsible for independently conducting quarterly events. "[It] is a platform to bring school students into public governance & welfare. The Council will work on fields like environment, climate change, civic responsibility, public policy, sports, art and culture," said Surya.

146.title: Who is India's highest run-scorer and highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cup history?
146.article_body: Rohit Sharma is India's highest run-scorer in T20 World Cup history, with 847 runs in 33 matches. He's followed by Virat Kohli, who has scored 845 runs in 21 T20 World Cup matches. Ravichandran Ashwin is India's highest wicket-taker in T20 World Cups, with 26 scalps. He is followed by Ravindra Jadeja (21), Harbhajan Singh (16) and Irfan Pathan (16).

147.title: My style is more aggressive: Ola CEO after report claims he called staff 'useless'
147.article_body: After a report, while citing employees, called Ola's work culture "hostile" and stated that CEO Bhavish Aggarwal used Punjabi epithets at staff and told them they were "useless", Aggarwal said, "My style is more aggressive than probably the average new-age entrepreneur." He added, "A sports environment is not where you have a nine-to-five (work). Ola is a place for...ambitious...people."

148.title: Drunk man bumps into vehicles in Chandigarh, hits ASI when he goes to help
148.article_body: A man who was reportedly in an inebriated state heckled people and bumped into vehicles in Chandigarh. Fearing that the man would hurt himself, a passerby called the Police Control Room.  When the Assistant Sub Inspector went to help after the PCR call, the drunk man beat him up. A police officer said that the man tore ASI's uniform.

149.title: Print of King Charles' artwork sells for ₹5.3 lakh, nearly 10 times estimate
149.article_body: A print of a painting by UK's King Charles III was sold for £5,737.50 (more than ₹5.3 lakh) at a recent auction, nearly 10 times its original estimate. The signed print is one of 100 and was estimated to sell for about £600. The King painted the original artwork depicting the Balmoral Castle, a royal residence in Scotland, in 2001.

150.title: I think Shami might miss out: Kumble on T20 WC 2022 match vs Pak
150.article_body: Ex-India head coach Anil Kumble said he thinks India will pick Harshal Patel, Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Arshdeep Singh as the main pacers in their lineup for their T20 World Cup 2022 match against Pakistan. "I think Mohammad Shami might miss out," added Kumble. Shami picked three wickets while conceding four runs in an over in a warm-up match against Australia.

151.title: It's disgusting: Shweta on trolls against brother Abhishek Bachchan
151.article_body: Shweta Bachchan said that she finds trolling against Abhishek Bachchan "disgusting" and "really upsetting". Shweta said that she finds it unfair that her brother is "constantly compared to something incomparable" like their father Amitabh Bachchan. "You just completely disregard someone's achievements because someone else in his family has done it better...I think it's disgusting," she added.

152.title: Dad or I aren't that rich to pay people to take me in their films: Janhvi
152.article_body: Actress Janhvi Kapoor said that her father or she are not that rich to offer money to people to cast her in their films. She said that the work she's getting now is based on her merit. "They must've appreciated something about me. Nobody is so large-hearted that they'd launch a star kid and take a monetary loss," she added.

153.title: No 'eventbaazi', provide employment: Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
153.article_body: As PM Narendra Modi launched a Rozgar Mela by handing over appointment letters to over 75,000 people, Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "No eventbaazi, provide employment." Furthermore, he added, "At least, the 'jumla king' has been forced by Rahul Gandhi to admit that unemployment is the biggest problem the country and the youth face."

154.title: Man tries to cheat in constable exam by hiding accomplice in washroom, held
154.article_body: An aspiring constable, Lalit Yadav, was arrested for allegedly trying to cheat in a recruitment exam by hiding an accomplice, Jaiveer, in the washroom. Jaiveer reportedly also wrote the exam on behalf of Yadav. Police also arrested an official at the exam centre in connection with the case. Police said they have procured CCTV footage from the exam centre.

155.title: Man threatens paan shop owner with air gun in Hyderabad; arrested
155.article_body: A man was arrested for allegedly creating a commotion in Hyderabad's Old City after he threatened a paan shop owner with an air gun on Saturday. An argument occurred after the accused bought three cigarettes from the shop and paid ₹10 but when the shop owner demanded that he should pay the remaining amount, he refused, a police official said.

156.title: Boy fails to alight from train in Navi Mumbai, reunited with family
156.article_body: A 10-year-old Nigerian boy was reunited with his family after he failed to alight from a train at Navi Mumbai's Vashi station and then lost his way, a railway police official said on Saturday. The boy is mentally unwell, the official added. "The boy, his mother, sibling and caretaker were travelling on a Harbour Line local," the official further said.

157.title: Pune man helping lady get illegal power connection for stall electrocuted
157.article_body: A 39-year-old man, Pravin Ashok, was electrocuted in Pune's Aundh after coming in contact with a live wire. He was reportedly helping an unknown lady with an illegal electricity connection for her firecracker stall. Ashok was a daily wage worker and was returning home when the incident took place. Locals immediately rushed him to hospital where he was declared dead.

158.title: Red Bull Co-founder Dietrich Mateschitz passes away aged 78
158.article_body: Red Bull Co-founder Dietrich Mateschitz has passed away at the age of 78. Mateschitz and Thai businessman Chaleo Yoovidhya founded Red Bull in 1984 and launched the Red Bull brand in 1987. Mateschitz owned 49% of the energy drinks brand. The Austrian billionaire bought the Jaguar Formula One team at 2004-end and rebranded it as Red Bull team.

159.title: Google Pixel uses iPhone to mock Apple CEO Tim Cook on Twitter, gets trolled
159.article_body: Google was trolled after the official Twitter handle for its flagship Pixel phone used an iPhone to mock Apple CEO Tim Cook. Google Pixel sent a tweet using an iPhone to troll Cook for using a hashtag that has previously been used by an NBA franchise. Google deleted the tweet after Twitter users called it out and reposted from web.

160.title: Means a hell lot to me: Dinesh Karthik on Ricky Ponting praising him
160.article_body: Reacting to a video of Ricky Ponting praising him and calling him "one of the best finishers", Dinesh Karthik wrote, "Thanks Ricky for these beautiful words...which mean a hell of a lot to me." He added, "I'm hoping to spend some time in...near future with you." Karthik also expressed his gratitude for Rohit Sharma and Abhishek Nayar in the post.

161.title: Barmy Army tweets 'What's an India vs Pakistan? Never heard of it'; gets trolled
161.article_body: Ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match in Melbourne, Barmy Army tweeted, "What's an India vs Pakistan...Never heard of it." Trolling Barmy Army, a fan wrote, "Is there any stable govt in England? Never heard of it." Another wrote, "Don't worry, it's a cricket thing, you guys wouldn't know." Another tweet read, "How can you forget your own creation?"

162.title: Ex-Chinese Prez wasn't feeling well: State media after he's escorted out of party meet
162.article_body: After former Chinese President Hu Jintao, who was seated next to Xi Jinping, was unexpectedly escorted out of the closing ceremony of a congress of the ruling Communist Party, state media said he "wasn't feeling well". China's official news agency Xinhua said Jintao insisted on attending the session "despite the fact that he has been taking time to recuperate recently."

163.title: He was kind enough to leave 4-yr-old girl alive: HC on reducing life sentence of her rapist
163.article_body: Madhya Pradesh High Court has reduced the sentence of life imprisonment, awarded to a man convicted of raping a four-year-old girl, to 20-year rigorous imprisonment. "Considering the fact that he was kind enough to leave the prosecutrix alive, this court is of the opinion that the life imprisonment can be reduced," the court said while calling the crime "demonic".

164.title: Have become greedier about the roles I want to do: Sonakshi Sinha
164.article_body: Actress Sonakshi Sinha said she has "become greedier" in terms of the roles she wants to do. "They have to be challenging me in some particular way or something very different from what I've done before," she said, adding that she still goes by her instinct. Sonakshi's upcoming release is 'Double XL', which also stars Huma Qureshi.

165.title: ISRO's heaviest rocket with 36 broadband satellites launched from Sriharikota
165.article_body: ISRO's heaviest rocket LVM3 with 36 broadband satellites onboard was launched from Sriharikota. The satellites belonged to OneWeb, a private communications firm, in which India's Bharti Enterprises is a major investor and shareholder. It is the first commercial mission of LVM3. Further, it is the first time an Indian rocket has been launched with six-ton payload, as per ISRO.

166.title: Hosting FIFA U-17 women's WC was a learning process: Odisha govt
166.article_body: Odisha Sports Secretary Vineel Krishna said that hosting the FIFA Under-17 Women's World Cup was a great learning process. "There are so many things involved in hosting a FIFA event...One has to take care of protocols ranging from security to accreditations," Krishna said. He added, "For the U-17 WC, we had the main stadium and another five training sites."

167.title: TN logs 214 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
167.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 214 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the state health department informed on Saturday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 3,316, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Chennai logged 53 new cases, the highest among all districts in the state.

168.title: Pak PM Shehbaz calls predecessor Imran Khan a 'certified thief’
168.article_body: Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif on Saturday called his predecessor Imran Khan a "certified thief" a day after the latter's disqualification over concealment of assets in the Toshakhana case. Pakistan's Election Commission on Friday disqualified Khan from holding public office for five years for failing to declare the money he received from selling state gifts during his tenure as PM.

169.title: Former Pakistani PM Imran Khan challenges disqualification from holding public office
169.article_body: Ex-Pakistani Prime Minister Imran Khan has challenged the Election Commission's ruling which disqualified him from holding public office for a period of five years, his lawyer said on Saturday. On Friday, the Election Commission barred Khan, saying he had illegally sold gifts of the state. With this ruling, Khan also lost his Parliamentary seat.

170.title: Swapna Suresh accuses 3 CPI(M) leaders of seeking sexual favours from her
170.article_body: Swapna Suresh, the prime accused in the 2020 Kerala gold smuggling case, on Friday accused three prominent leaders of the ruling CPI(M) of seeking sexual favours from her. The leaders include former Assembly Speaker P Sreeramakrishnan and former ministers Thomas Isaac and Kadakampally Surendran. Swapna said, "Surendran is a very dirty, pathetic, frustrated and manipulative gentleman."

171.title: Pirelli's 2023 tires can be a huge factor for Ferrari: Carlos Sainz
171.article_body: Ferrari's Carlos Sainz said Pirelli's new tires for the 2023 F1 season might be "a huge factor" for the team. "We need to see what the tyre does to the balance of the car...it will be super interesting to see what Pirelli has come up with," said Sainz. Ferrari has reportedly suffered from high tire degradation in the 2022 season.

172.title: Category 4 hurricane heads towards Mexico's Pacific coast
172.article_body: Hurricane Roslyn on Saturday strengthened to Category 4 force, as it headed for Mexico's Pacific coast. The storm was centered around 170 miles (275 km) south-southwest of Mexican municipality Cabo Corrientes. Roslyn's maximum sustained windspeed rose to 130 mph (215 km/h) on Saturday and was expected to gain further speed, said the US National Hurricane Center.

173.title: Ballon d'Or winner Benzema suffering from muscle fatigue: Real Madrid
173.article_body: Ballon d'Or winner Karim Benzema will miss Real Madrid's match against Sevilla due to a thigh injury. "After the tests today on Karim Benzema...they detected muscular fatigue in the quadriceps of his left leg," said Real Madrid. Benzema, who missed most of September with a thigh strain in his right leg, has five goals in seven league appearances this season.

174.title: Demand for separate 'Frontier Nagaland' state not wrong: CM Rio
174.article_body: Nagaland CM Neiphiu Rio said there is nothing wrong with the demand for a separate state called 'Frontier Nagaland' and that the issue would be resolved soon. "Nagas are very outspoken. They speak their minds out. What they think, and desire," said Rio. Recently, 20 MLAs declared that they will boycott the 2023 Assembly election until the demand is met.

175.title: Take money from BJP, vote for TRS: KTR ahead of Munugode by-polls
175.article_body: Ahead of by-polls in Munugode constituency, TRS working president KTR on Friday urged people to take money from the BJP, but vote for TRS.
