KTR's comment came after Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar asked voters to take money from TRS, but elect BJP's Raj Gopal Reddy. KTR alleged that Reddy was openly distributing money to lure voters.

176.title: NIA joins investigation into reported al-Qaeda module in Assam
176.article_body: The Union Home Ministry has directed the National Investigation Agency (NIA) to join the investigation into a reported al-Qaeda module operating in Assam. The module is reportedly connected with Bangladesh-based terror group Ansarullah Bangla Team. According to reports, the module aims to "propagate terror in Indian territory, radicalise likeminded youth and carry out recruitment to wage war".

177.title: Vatican and China extend agreement on appointment of bishops
177.article_body: The Vatican and China extended their agreement on appointment of bishops in the East Asian country on Saturday. In a statement, the Holy See said the 2018 arrangement had been renewed by two years. Entire details of the agreement have never been made public. Earlier, conservative Catholics criticised the deal in view of Beijing's opposition to religious practices.

178.title: What is the average age of India and Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 teams?
178.article_body: The average age of India squad for T20 World Cup 2022 is 30.5 years. Ten of India players are aged 30 or above. Dinesh Karthik is the oldest member of India squad aged 37, while Arshdeep is the youngest at 23. Meanwhile, the average age of Pakistan squad is 26.2. Shan Masood is oldest member of Pakistan squad at 32.

179.title: Surya doesn't bother me because you can't bat like Viv Richards daily: Aamer
179.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match in Melbourne on Sunday, former Pakistan skipper Aamer Sohail said that Indian batter Suryakumar doesn't bother him because one can't bat like Viv Richards every day. "Considering Pakistan's bowling line-up, I will go with the Pakistani team [as favourites]...[However,] India also have a lot of talented players," Sohail said.

180.title: Haaland scores twice as Manchester City beat Brighton 3-1 at Etihad
180.article_body: Erling Haaland scored twice and Kevin De Bruyne scored a second-half goal as Manchester City beat Brighton & Hove Albion 3-1 at the Etihad Stadium. The victory moved City on to 26 points from 11 games, one behind league leaders Arsenal. Brighton pulled a goal back when Leandro Trossard scored from the edge of the box against City goalkeeper Ederson.

181.title: UP woman sent 'triple talaq' over WhatsApp by Saudi-based husband
181.article_body: A 27-year-old woman in UP's Aligarh has filed a police complaint claiming that her husband gave her "triple talaq" over WhatsApp from Saudi Arabia. The woman further claimed that she had regular fights with her husband over his dowry demands. The man allegedly sent his wife the triple talaq letter via WhatsApp in the form of a PDF file.

182.title: Karnataka permits use of loudspeakers in 10,889 mosques, 3,000 temples
182.article_body: The Karnataka government has granted permission to 10,889 mosques, 3,000 temples and 1,400 churches in the state to use loudspeakers. The licence has been given for a period of two years. The loudspeakers can only be played between 6 am and 10 pm. A total of 17,850 applications were submitted by mosques, temples and churches for the use of loudspeakers.

183.title: What multiple records were broken in T20 World Cup 2022 today?
183.article_body: New Zealand's Tim Southee became the sole leading wicket-taker in T20I cricket with 125 scalps, overtaking Bangladesh captain Shakib Al Hasan's 122-wicket mark. New Zealand recorded their highest-ever total in T20 WC history (200/3). Sam Curran became the first-ever Englishman to take a five-wicket haul in T20Is. New Zealand also recorded their biggest win (by runs) in T20 WC history.

184.title: Harsha Bhogle names his combined India-Pakistan XI ahead of T20 World Cup match
184.article_body: Commentator Harsha Bhogle on Saturday named his combined India-Pakistan XI ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 match. Bhogle named captains Rohit Sharma and Babar Azam as openers. He named Virat Kohli and Suryakumar Yadav as number three and four batters, respectively. Other players include Muhammad Rizwan, Hardik Pandya, Shadab Khan, Axar Patel, Mohammad Shami, Shaheen Afridi and Haris Rauf.

185.title: Dengue situation in state completely under control: UP Dy CM Pathak
185.article_body: UP Deputy CM Brajesh Pathak claimed that the dengue situation in the state is under control. He added that people should wear full-sleeve clothes, use mosquito nets and keep their surroundings clean. Pathak further directed all chief medical officers to conduct regular inspections of hospitals, ensure that private pathology labs do not overcharge and ensure patients don't face any problems.

186.title: Curran is thriving with extra responsibility of bowling at death: Buttler
186.article_body: England skipper Jos Buttler said Sam Curran has "character" for bowling at the death after the all-rounder took five wickets to help his side register a five-wicket win against Afghanistan in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. "He's thriving with the extra responsibility. He demands the ball in those situations," he added. Curran posted bowling figures of 3.4-0-10-5.

187.title: Assistant jailer, constable arrested for being drunk in Bihar
187.article_body: An assistant jailer of Bihar's Buxar open jail and a police constable were arrested after they were allegedly found drunk on Saturday. "The anti-liquor task force of Bihar arrested accused near the Bihar-UP border in Buxar on charges of flouting the ban on sale and consumption of alcohol," police said. The accused were sent for medical examination at the hospital.

188.title: Twitter user calls Abhishek Bachchan 'unemployed', actor responds
188.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan responded to a person who said that he was "unemployed". After Abhishek wrote, "Do people still read newspapers??" while replying to a Twitter user, a troll replied, "Intelligent people do. Not unemployed people like you." "Intelligence and employment aren't related...I'm sure you're employed, I'm also sure (judging by your tweet) that you're not intelligent!" Abhishek replied.

189.title: We didn't put good total on board: Afghanistan skipper on loss to England
189.article_body: Following Afghanistan's five-wicket loss against England in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match, Afghanistan skipper Mohammad Nabi said his side didn't put a good total on the board. Put to bat first, Afghanistan were bowled out for 112 in 19.4 overs. "It is not a good start, but we tried our best to play good cricket," he added.

190.title: Nottingham Forest beat Liverpool 1-0 to move off last place in PL
190.article_body: Nottingham Forest, who were at the bottom of the Premier League table, beat Liverpool 1-0 at the City Ground stadium to seal their second win of the season. Forest went ahead in the 55th minute when Taiwo Awoniyi hit a rebound after his initial effort struck the post. Forest are now in 19th place with nine points from 12 games.

191.title: 70-yr-old farmer killed by tiger in Maha's Chandrapur; 2nd death in 3 days
191.article_body: A 70-year-old farmer was killed by a tiger on Saturday in Brahmapuri tehsil of Maharashtra's Chandrapur, a forest department official said. Sadashiv Undirwade was at his farm near a forested patch when a tiger pounced on him, killing him instantly, Chandrapur Territorial Circle official said. On October 20, a 40-year-old woman was killed by a tiger in Brahmapuri tehsil.

192.title: Crisis-hit Sri Lanka trims Presidential powers
192.article_body: Sri Lankan lawmakers have voted in favour of amending the Constitution to reduce Presidential powers. The vote, which was held on Friday, came following demands from protesters to reform the country to ease economic difficulties. Now, the President cannot recruit key institutional figures such as senior judges, the attorney general, central bank governors, among other such positions.

193.title: Drunk jail official, constable arrested in Bihar
193.article_body: An assistant jailer of Buxar open jail in Bihar and a constable were arrested on Saturday after they were found in a drunken state, police said. It is suspected the duo consumed liquor in neighbouring UP and then entered Bihar. There has been a ban on the manufacture, trade, storage, transportation, sale, and consumption of liquor in Bihar since 2016.

194.title: Death toll in Banmore house blast rises to five
194.article_body: Another person succumbed to injuries in the Banmore house blast in Madhya Pradesh on Saturday, taking the death toll to five. Four people had died on the spot on Thursday when an explosion went off at a house, which had a stock of crackers in its godown. The house collapsed following the powerful explosion.

195.title: Punjab to form energy action plan to reduce emissions: Officials
195.article_body: Punjab will form an energy action plan to reduce greenhouse gas emissions, said Chief Executive of Punjab Energy Development Agency (PEDA) Sumeet Jarangal. He said innovative clean energy technologies will have to be adopted to reduce emissions. He added that PEDA is striving to attain the target of 2,500 MW renewable energy capacity in Punjab.

196.title: ISRO set to launch 36 OneWeb broadband communication satellites
196.article_body: The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is all set to launch 36 broadband communication satellites from the Satish Dhawan Space Centre in Andhra Pradesh's Sriharikota on Sunday. A 43.5-metre-tall rocket is going to carry the satellites, which will be placed in the Low Earth Orbit (LEO). The total weight of the 36 OneWeb satellites in LEO is about 5,796 kilograms.

197.title: Odisha man gets 15 years in jail for raping minor girl
197.article_body: A court in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district on Saturday sentenced a man to 15 years of rigorous imprisonment for the rape of a minor girl in 2014. The victim was 15 years old at the time of the offence, according to the prosecution. The convict raped her when she was alone in her house. The teenager got pregnant following the incident.

198.title: 4 MLAs from Uddhav faction are in touch with me: BJP's Rane
198.article_body: BJP leader Narayan Rane said that four Shiv Sena MLAs from the Uddhav Thackeray faction are in touch with him but he won't take the names. "From 56 MLAs, there are hardly six to seven left [in the Uddhav Thackeray faction]. Those too are on the way out," Rane, who is also a Union Minister, said.

199.title: Saw pools of blood, heard cries like 'God save me': Rewa mishap survivor
199.article_body: A 30-year-old labourer who survived the bus accident in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa said he was fast asleep and was celebrating Diwali in his dreams when the accident took place. "I woke up to a loud thud...[and heard] cries like 'God save me, God help me'," Subhash Choudhary added. "I saw...people [lying] in pools of blood inside the bus," he claimed.

200.title: Fire occurs in sweet shop in Odisha's Rourkela; 1 dead
200.article_body: A fire occurred in a sweet shop in Odisha's Rourkela on Saturday. The incident led to the death of the confectioner and sweets worth over ₹2 lakh, which were being prepared for Diwali, were destroyed, police said. The deceased, Arun Yadav, hailed from Bihar's Gaya and was brought to Rourkela due to the soaring demand ahead of Diwali.

201.title: Rubina gets injured while rehearsing for Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa, shares pic of neck injury
201.article_body: 'Jhalak Dikhhla Jaa 10' contestant Rubina Dilaik was injured while rehearsing with her partner-choreographer Sanam Johar. She shared a picture of her injured neck and a video from rehearsal. In the video, Sanam can be seen running towards her to practise their dance stunt but instead ends up hitting her accidentally. "Few things are not in our control," wrote Rubina.

202.title: SA are 'chupe rustam', easily capable of beating the best in T20 WC: Farokh
202.article_body: Talking about South Africa's chances at T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Farokh Engineer said they are a 'chupe rustam'. He added, "They're a very dangerous side...easily capable of beating the best. I won't be surprised if South Africa even come in the final." He further said, "My four (semi-finalists)- Australia, England, India and either South Africa or Pakistan."

203.title: What is the latest weather forecast for Melbourne where India will face Pak tomorrow?
203.article_body: India are scheduled to face Pakistan in T20 World Cup 2022 in Melbourne tomorrow. Australia's Bureau of Meteorology stated there could be "an afternoon shower or two" in Melbourne tomorrow. It added there's 70% chance of "any rain" in Melbourne tomorrow, most likely in the "late afternoon and evening". Earlier, the bureau stated that there was 90% chance of rain.

204.title: Russia launches 36 missiles at Ukraine, 15 lakh people left without electricity: Zelenskyy
204.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that Russia launched around 36 missiles at Ukraine overnight. He added that most of those missiles were shot down. He further stated that around 15 lakh people across Ukraine were left without electricity due to Russia's attacks. October 24 will mark eight months since the war commenced.

205.title: We've plans for everyone, not just Suryakumar: Babar ahead of Pak vs India
205.article_body: Ahead of Pakistan's first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against India, Pakistan captain Babar Azam said his side has plans for every player and not just Suryakumar Yadav. "We have plans and hopefully, we can execute them properly," he added. The match will be played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground on Sunday.

206.title: 5 minor girls collecting soil from drain drown in Uttar Pradesh village
206.article_body: Five girls, aged between nine and 13, drowned while collecting soil from a drain in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur on Saturday, police said. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath has expressed deep sorrow over the loss of lives. While the bodies of four girls were pulled out shortly after the incident, divers recovered the fifth girl's body in the evening.

207.title: BJP will form government in Himachal Pradesh again: Anurag Thakur
207.article_body: Union Minister and BJP leader Anurag Thakur on Saturday said his party will form government in Himachal Pradesh again as people have seen the working of "double-engine" government. "We'll get the benefit of the leadership which PM Narendra Modi gave in the country and...CM Jairam Thakur at the state level," he said, adding BJP will also retain power in Gujarat.

208.title: Chemistry lab roof collapses at 105-yr-old Maharani college in Mysuru
208.article_body: The roof of the chemistry lab at 105-year-old Maharani's Science College for Women in Mysuru collapsed on Friday. No injuries were reported. Minutes before the mishap took place, principal Dr D Ravi had instructed the staff to disconnect the power supply and lock the lab. The chemistry department's head had alerted him about water seepage in the roof.

209.title: 3 people test positive for Ebola in Uganda's capital Kampala
209.article_body: Three people in an isolation unit of Uganda's main hospital in the capital city of Kampala tested positive for Ebola on Friday, Uganda's Health Minister said. The three confirmed cases are the first known transmission of the virus in the city. This came on the same day the government said the country's current Ebola outbreak was coming under control.

210.title: Kerala replacing Punjab as 'capital of drugs': Guv Arif Mohammed Khan
210.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan on Saturday said the state was replacing Punjab as the "capital of drugs". He said he felt ashamed that the two main sources of revenue of the state were lottery and alcohol. "What a shameful situation for a state which has 100% literacy," he said, adding liquor consumption was being encouraged in the state.

211.title: 4 Maoists, including 1 woman, arrested in J'khand's Palamu district
211.article_body: Four alleged Maoists, including a woman, were arrested in Jharkhand's Palamu district on Saturday, police said. The individuals were reportedly arrested during a police raid in the Chhatarpur area, around 200 km from Ranchi. "We had arrested self-styled sub-zonal commander of CPI (Maoist), Ram Prasad Yadav, two days back. Based on his inputs, four other Maoists were nabbed," police stated.

212.title: There is infighting in BJP families over MLA tickets in Himachal: Lamba
212.article_body: Congress spokesperson Alka Lamba said that there is "infighting in BJP families" of Himachal Pradesh over the MLA tickets distribution. "I recently visited the Mandi region. BJP Minister Mahender Singh Thakur is an example of BJP practising dynastic politics as his son has been given a ticket," Lamba said. She added that unemployment and inflation are key issues in Himachal.

213.title: Maha to take TN Police's help after 10 idols get stolen from Ram temple
213.article_body: Police in Maharashtra will take the help of Tamil Nadu Police to solve the theft of idols from a Ram temple in Jalna, SP Akshay Shinde said on Saturday. At least 10 idols were allegedly stolen from the temple in the village, which is the birthplace of the saint Ramdas Samarth. Police have scanned all phone calls made during investigation.

214.title: 3 killed in accident in UP's Hamirpur; accused absconding
214.article_body: Three people were killed in a road accident near the Maudaha intersection on Kabrai Sagar Road in Hamirpur, UP. The accident occurred when the vehicle in which the three deceased were travelling collided with a dumper, police said. The deceased have been identified as Lakhanlal (35), Pawan (29) and Rahul (19). Notably, the dumper's driver is still absconding.

215.title: Tehran condemns call for probe into alleged use of Iranian drones in Ukraine
215.article_body: Tehran on Saturday strongly condemned a call by France, Germany and Britain for the UN to probe the alleged involvement of Iranian-made drones in attacks against Ukrainian targets by Russian forces, Iran's Foreign Ministry said. The ministry dismissed the accusations as "false and baseless". Iran denies supplying drones to Russia for the war in Ukraine.

216.title: We were clinical: NZ captain Williamson on their 89-run win vs Australia
216.article_body: New Zealand skipper Kane Williamson said his side was clinical in their win against defending champions Australia in T20 World Cup 2022. "Everyone knows their roles in this team, we knew about the quality of their bowling (Australia's), took the game deep," he added. New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in their first Super 12 stage match on Saturday.

217.title: 18-yr-old Gauff is the same age as my career: 33-yr-old Azarenka
217.article_body: After 33-year-old Victoria Azarenka defeated 18-year-old Coco Gauff in Guadalajara Open Akron quarter-final, the ex-world number one said, "I was just thinking, 'Coco is the same age as my career,' so it felt pretty interesting." Azarenka added, "She's such a great athlete...I can't wait to see how far she'll go." The two-time Grand Slam champion turned pro in 2003.

218.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹8 lakh after clicking on bogus ad on Facebook
218.article_body: A Mumbai-based woman lost ₹8.46 lakh after she clicked on a fraudulent Facebook advertisement about a 'buy one get one free' offer for Maharaja Bhog Thalis. The woman claimed that while trying to pay ₹200 she inadvertently allowed remote access to her phone using which the fraudsters withdrew the amount from her account in 27 transactions, the Bandra Police said.

219.title: England beat Afghanistan as Curran records best T20I bowling figures by an Englishman
219.article_body: England defeated Afghanistan by five wickets in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. England dismissed Afghanistan for 112 runs in 19.4 overs and chased down the target in 18.1 overs. The match witnessed fast bowler Sam Curran become the first-ever England bowler to take a five-wicket haul in men's T20I cricket history.

220.title: 4 of a family killed as boulder falls on houses in Uttarakhand
220.article_body: Four members of a family were killed after a massive boulder fell on three houses after a landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli on Saturday, the State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) said. The deceased were identified as 75-year-old Bachuli Devi, 37-year-old Sunita Devi, 57-year-old Devanand and 45-year-old Ghananand. A 15-year-old boy, who sustained injuries, was referred to the higher centre.

221.title: They hit me in the crotch, locked me up in the loo of a jail: Arnab Goswami on his arrest
221.article_body: Republic TV's Editor-in-Chief Arnab Goswami, while speaking about his arrest in November 2020, said, "They were pushing me with the butt of their weapons, hitting me in the crotch, thrashing me and not even letting me wear my shoes." "[They locked] me up in the loo of a jail, [did] things which are unbelievable," he added.

222.title: Goa CM urges citizens to encourage 'vocal for local' initiative this Diwali
222.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Saturday urged citizens to encourage the "vocal for local" initiative and consider local products while shopping for Diwali festival. "It may be akashkandil (lantern), eatables or even flowers, always choose to buy items that are made locally," he said. Sawant said that he himself has put up a lantern made of coconut tree leaves.

223.title: Robin Uthappa names his 4 semi-finalists of T20 World Cup 2022, excludes India
223.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper-batter Robin Uthappa has named four teams which according to him will be the semi-finalists at the ongoing T20 World Cup 2022. "My semi-finalists would be Australia, England, Pakistan, and South Africa," said Uthappa. On excluding India, Uthappa said, "I do not think [Indian fans] would be too happy [with my prediction]."

224.title: Pilots sent 'Mayday' call moments before Army helicopter crash in Arunachal
224.article_body: Pilots of an Indian Army helicopter, which crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang, killing five, had issued a 'Mayday' call to the Air Traffic Control (ATC). According to officials, the pilot had reached out to the ATC flagging a technical failure in the aircraft. "It is reported that the weather was good for flying operations," a Defence spokesperson said.

225.title: Kids of photojournalist Danish, who was killed in Afghanistan, receive his Pulitzer Prize
225.article_body: Reuters photojournalist Danish Siddiqui's children accepted the Pulitzer Prize on his behalf. Danish Siddiqui was killed while covering the Afghanistan conflict in July last year. Yunus Siddiqui, 6, Sarah Siddiqui, 4, children of the late Danish Siddiqui received the award in a ceremony in New York. He was also awarded the Pulitzer Prize in 2018.

226.title: Are BSF jawans eating biryani and sleeping at the border?: Owaisi
226.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned the Centre and BSF after the RSS blamed infiltration for an alleged population imbalance in India. "If people are coming from Bangladesh, what are your BSF jawans doing at the border? Eating biryani and sleeping?" questioned Owaisi. The RSS claimed that conversion and Bangladeshi migrants were the primary reasons behind the alleged population imbalance.

227.title: Ashok Gehlot hosts Diwali lunch for kids who lost parents to COVID-19
227.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Friday hosted a Diwali programme for more than 200 children who recently lost both their parents to COVID-19. The programme, reportedly organised at his residence, included a luncheon, a magic show and other activities. The 71-year-old leader was seen interacting with children and participating in games with them. He said children were also given gifts.

228.title: Magnitude 5.5 earthquake hits China's western Sichuan region
228.article_body: A 5.5-magnitude earthquake struck the western part of China's Sichuan province on Saturday, the European Mediterranean Seismological Centre (EMSC) said. The earthquake's focus was located at a depth of 80 km, the EMSC informed. Last month, on September 5, an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 struck Luding County in Sichuan province causing the death of 93 people and injuring hundreds.

229.title: 7 persons injured in blast at Bharat Petroleum oil depot near Bhopal
229.article_body: Seven persons sustained injuries in a blast that occurred at the Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited's (BPCL) depot on the outskirts of Bhopal in Madhya Pradesh, police said on Saturday. "Six of the injured persons are either drivers or helpers of the Hindustan Petroleum Corporation Limited (HPCL), who were there to get fuel filled in their tankers," an officer said.

230.title: MCG pitch should make for a really good IND-PAK game: Curator
230.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match in Melbourne on Sunday, MCG pitch curator Michael Salvatore said that the wicket should make for a really good game between the two sides. "So we have drop-in wickets here at the MCG. So for the cricket season, we bring the wickets in and I sit on some sand and bed in nicely," Salvatore said.

231.title: It's a challenge for India to come out on top in ICC tournaments: Rohit
231.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma said it's a challenge for the team to come out on top in ICC tournaments given their record in the last nine years. India haven't won an ICC trophy since MS Dhoni-led India won Champions Trophy in 2013. Rohit added that his side have the opportunity to do well in ongoing T20 World Cup in Australia.

232.title: We were completely outplayed: Aus captain on loss vs NZ in T20 WC 2022
232.article_body: After Australia's 89-run defeat against New Zealand in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match, Australia captain Aaron Finch said his side was completely outplayed. He added that New Zealand openers set the tone in the first four overs and the defending champions didn't recover. Chasing 201, Australia were bowled out for 111 in 17.1 overs.

233.title: Percentage of NCR houses bursting crackers this Diwali could be highest in 5 yrs: Survey
233.article_body: The percentage of households in Delhi-NCR that will burst firecrackers on Diwali could be the highest in five years, according to a survey. The survey, which was conducted by LocalCircles, said two of every five families are likely to burst crackers. About 10% of the surveyed said they had bought crackers from shops in Delhi.

234.title: Delhi Police officer's daughter arrested for hitting man with car
234.article_body: A senior Delhi Police official's daughter was arrested on Saturday for allegedly hitting a parking valet with her car earlier this week at a mall in Delhi's Saket area, ANI reported. The incident was reportedly caught on surveillance cameras. The woman's car allegedly ran over the valet's legs while he was attending to a customer, leaving him injured.

235.title: KL Rahul is correct enough to rack up runs in T20 WC 2022: Pietersen
235.article_body: Kevin Pietersen has predicted India opener KL Rahul to end T20 World Cup 2022 as the highest run-scorer. "With the ball bouncing, swinging and seaming, I think he plays in a very authentic way and is correct enough to rack up the runs," said Pietersen. "He is the number one batter in the world at the moment," he added.

236.title: Former village head shot over political rivalry in UP
236.article_body: A former village head was shot in Ballan village in Banda, UP on Saturday. The accused, Bhanjan Singh (56), has been arrested in connection with the incident, which seems to have taken place allegedly over a political rivalry, police said. The victim, Omkar Dwivedi (54), was rushed to the Kanpur medical college where his condition remains critical, police added.

237.title: Former Pune Municipal Commissioner blames "slothful" citizens for flooding
237.article_body: Former Pune Municipal Commissioner Mahesh Zagade has blamed "clueless" civic body officials and "slothful" citizens for the recent flooding and traffic chaos in the city. "I will not blame the politicians for the mess Pune city finds itself in. I will instead blame Pune's fast asleep citizens and clueless PMC officials for the nightmare," Zagade said.

238.title: DCP Bhagyashree Navtake to take charge of Pune traffic branch
238.article_body: Commissioner of Police, Pune, Amitabh Gupta has ordered Deputy Commissioner of Police (Economic Offences Wing and Cyber Cell) Bhagyashree Navtake to take charge of the traffic branch. The decision was taken even as DCP (Traffic) Rahul Shrirame continues in his post. According to the order, Shrirame will have to "submit a report to Navtake regarding traffic work".

239.title: Noida Traffic Police issues advisory for festive period
239.article_body: The Noida Traffic Police has issued a traffic advisory for the festive period of Dhanteras, Diwali and Bhai Dooj. According to which, Indira Market, Atta Market, Sector 18 Market, Gurudwara, Gardens Galleria Mall, GIP Mall and surrounding areas are no parking zones. The stretch from Attapir Chowk to Car Market Sector 28 will be banned for rickshaws from 2 pm.

240.title: Journalist asks 'Are all players singing 'Rain Rain Go Away'?', Babar's response goes viral
240.article_body: A video of Pakistan captain Babar Azam's response to a journalist asking "Are all players singing 'Rain Rain Go Away?'" ahead of India-Pakistan T20 World Cup match in Melbourne went viral. "No sir...We aren't singing lullaby to...child," Babar joked. He added weather isn't in players' hands. There are 70% chances of rain in Melbourne on Sunday, as per forecast.

241.title: Man uses B'luru sexologist's identity to harass women with pics on FB
241.article_body: A 35-year-old man was arrested last week for misusing the identity of a renowned sexologist in Bengaluru on social media. The arrest was made after medical practitioner Dr Padmini Prasad lodged a complaint with cyber police. According to police, the accused created fake Facebook accounts in the name of Prasad to approach women and harass them with messages and pictures.

242.title: Bengaluru has received 311 mm of rainfall in October so far: IMD
242.article_body: In October, Bengaluru has so far received 311 mm of rainfall, which is a deviation of 189 mm from the normal, as per the India Meteorological Department (IMD). Further, Bengaluru has already received 1,795.5 mm of rainfall this year. "Owing to increasing concretisation, the rainfall pattern has...been erratic and the city is receiving heavy rainfall," an IMD scientist said.

243.title: Curran creates history, becomes 1st England bowler to take a 5-wicket haul in T20Is
243.article_body: England's 24-year-old all-rounder Sam Curran has created history by becoming the first-ever England bowler to take a five-wicket haul in T20I cricket. Curran registered bowling figures of 3.4-0-10-5 against Afghanistan in England's first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday to achieve the feat. His figures helped England bowl Afghanistan out for 112 in 19.4 overs.

244.title: Hyderabad Police arrest 3 vehicle thieves; 2 cars, 2 bikes seized
244.article_body: The Hyderabad Police on Friday arrested three vehicle thieves, identified as Syed Ahmed, Syed Omer and Shaik Ameer. Police recovered two Indica cars and two bikes from the accused. Another accused, identified as Jaffar, is currently absconding, the police stated in a press release. Two accused and recovered vehicles were handed over to Cyberabad Police for further action, police stated.

245.title: Two arrested after police raid Thane spa for vulgar activities
245.article_body: The Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar Police raided a spa on Mira Road that was alleged to be indulging in vulgar activities under the guise of massage services. Acting on a tip-off, the police deputed a decoy customer to bust the racket and arrested a female employee and an operator. The Ank Luxurious Salon and Spa is located in the Kanakia area.

246.title: Indian campaign ends at Denmark Open as Lakshya loses in quarters
246.article_body: Commonwealth Games 2022 gold medal-winning shuttler Lakshya Sen crashed out of Denmark Open 2022 on Friday. The 21-year-old lost to Japan's Kodai Naraoka 17-21, 12-21 in the men's singles quarter-final. With this, the Indian campaign ended in Odense. Earlier in the day, Indian men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty lost in the quarter-final.

247.title: NMMC seizes over 1.40 lakh kg of single-use plastic in last 3 months
247.article_body: The Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation (NMMC) has seized over 1.40 lakh kg of plastic in the last three months, the highest since the state banned single-use plastic in 2018. Last week, civic officials seized over 800 kg of banned plastic from a wholesale seller. The team also caught the female salesperson selling plastic bags to vendors and hawkers every day.

248.title: Villagers bathe in mud water to protest against bad roads in Karnataka
248.article_body: Locals took bath in the mud water accumulated on a road in Karnataka's Hulikeri village to protest against the poor condition of roads in the area. The protesters also shouted slogans against the authorities. They claimed officials have taken no action despite repeated requests from villagers. A nearly four km stretch of road is currently flooded in the area.

249.title: Manage glucose confidently this festive season: Abbott FreeStyle Libre
249.article_body: Abbott's FreeStyle Libre is a sensor-based continuous glucose monitoring device that helps people with diabetes track their glucose levels. This wearable product monitors glucose levels without fingerpricks & calculates time spent in the desired range. It enables users make informed decisions on lifestyle modifications and dietary control, owing to the ease of sharing real-time data with experts.

250.title: Solid start for their campaign: Irfan on NZ's 89-run win vs Aus in T20 WC
250.article_body: Reacting to New Zealand's 89-run win against Australia in T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage, Irfan Pathan tweeted, "Kiwis dominated the game from the first over. Solid start for their campaign." Wasim Jaffer said, "New Zealand beat Australia and declare the T20 World Cup open!!" Ian Bishop tweeted, "Fantastic opening performance by 2021 runners-up against the defending champs."

251.title: Argentina fear no one at 2022 FIFA World Cup: Messi
251.article_body: Argentinian skipper Lionel Messi said that his side fears no one at the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup. "Today we are doing well and people are excited and think that we will come back with the WC, but it is not like that," Messi said. He added, "WC is very difficult, many things have to happen [to win it]."

252.title: Crypto exchange Gate.io's Twitter compromised to promote fake giveaway: Report
252.article_body: Hackers of unknown origin gained control of the official Twitter account of cryptocurrency exchange Gate.io and altered the website URL to a fraudulent website mimicking the exchange, Cointelegraph reported. The fake website reportedly promoted a fake giveaway of 500,000 USDT and asked users to connect their wallets. Rewards are used as a pretext to gain access to users' personal funds.

253.title: UK lawmaker Matheson resigns over ‘unwanted sexual advances’
253.article_body: UK lawmaker Christian Matheson has resigned after a parliamentary watchdog recommended his suspension over "serious sexual misconduct". The watchdog said Matheson had breached parliament's sexual misconduct policy by making "unwanted and unwelcome" advances towards a junior staff member. Matheson allegedly invited the colleague on a private trip abroad, which was found to be "sexually motivated".

254.title: AIIMS Delhi chief issues order to stop vendors from sending him gifts
254.article_body: AIIMS Delhi Director, Dr M Srinivas, has directed the medical college and hospital's security and administration officials to not let representatives of vendors, contractors and agencies into his office with gifts on festive occasions. "I do not accept gifts or greetings from such people," the newly-appointed AIIMS Delhi chief said in an order, as per media reports.

255.title: Pic shows remains of a supernova, Instagram user says 'Beyond beautiful'
255.article_body: NASA shared a composite image showing the remains of a supernova, around 9,000 light-years from Earth, in three bands of X-ray light detected by Chandra X-ray Observatory telescope. It shows low energy X-rays in red, medium in green, and the highest in blue. "Beyond beautiful...space is magical and mysterious," an Instagram user commented, while another comment read, "This is awesome."

256.title: MP CM Shivraj Chouhan to celebrate Diwali with COVID orphans at his residence
256.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that he would celebrate Diwali at his residence with children who lost their parents due to COVID-19. "I will celebrate the festival of Diwali with my sons, daughters, nephews, and nieces who have lost their parents...I feel happy to celebrate the festival with them and to share happiness with them," said Chouhan.

257.title: 150 bottles of premium foreign liquor seized in excise raids in Delhi
257.article_body: The Delhi government's excise department has arrested five people and registered three separate FIRs in connection with the adulteration of high-end foreign liquor. Almost 150 bottles of premium foreign liquor and 20 empty bottles were recovered during the raids. The gang included some bartenders who mixed premium foreign liquor with cheap Indian Made Foreign Liquor (IMFL) for sale purposes.

258.title: RSS raising religious conversion issue to divert attention: BSP chief
258.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Saturday alleged that RSS is raising issues related to religious conversion and population policy to divert people's attention from failures of BJP-led government at Centre. She said it is an irony that the RSS supports the BJP in every election with its "eyes closed". "Its silence on the prevailing atmosphere in the country is...harmful," Mayawati said.

259.title: 3 members of disbanded Hong Kong pro-democracy group jailed
259.article_body: Three members of the now-disbanded Hong Kong pro-democracy student group, Student Politicism, have been sentenced to up to three years in prison for conspiracy to incite subversion. The activists, aged 19 to 21, were accused of making speeches and handing out leaflets urging public to overthrow the Chinese government. Wong Yat-chin, Chan Chi-sum and Jessica Chu pleaded guilty in July.

260.title: 4 friends celebrating a birthday drown in pond at temple in Thane
260.article_body: Four of five friends from Mumbai who had gone to Thane to celebrate a birthday drowned in a pond next to the Kondeshwar Shiv temple on Friday. According to police, the friends jumped into the pond unaware that it was deep after a certain point. One of them, 19-year-old Pratik Hate, managed to swim to safety, but the remaining drowned.

261.title: 59-year-old Mumbai man loses leg while trying to board BEST bus
261.article_body: A 59-year-old resident of Mumbai, Surendra Shinde, lost his left leg while he was trying to board a BEST bus in Sewri area on October 18. He was admitted to KEM Hospital where his leg was amputated below the knee. "His right leg was on the steps, but due to the jerking movement...the loose sheet crushed his...leg," Shinde's relative said.

262.title: Bank of Baroda-backed IndiaFirst Life Insurance files DRHP with SEBI for IPO
262.article_body: IndiaFirst Life Insurance, backed by Bank of Baroda (BoB) filed its draft red herring prospectus (DRHP) with SEBI for an IPO this year. The IPO will comprise a fresh issue of ₹500 crore and an offer for sale of 14.12 crore shares. BoB has a 65% stake in the life insurer and Union Bank of India has a 9% stake.

263.title: H'wood filmmaker approaches Vipul Amrutlal Shah for remake rights of 'Sanak'
263.article_body: Hollywood filmmaker Kylan Tyng has approached filmmaker Vipul Amrutlal Shah for the remake rights of 'Sanak', a 2021 action-thriller film which featured Vidyut Jammwal and Neha Dhupia, among others. Talking about it, Vipul said, "I'm the only person whose two films have been inquired [about] by Hollywood for remakes...I am super excited and I really hope that this will materialise."

264.title: PM Modi, Amit Shah, Nadda among BJP campaigners for Himachal polls
264.article_body: The BJP on Friday released a list of 40 campaigners for the upcoming Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections. The list features Prime Minister Narendra Modi, party chief JP Nadda, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and Home Minister Amit Shah. Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath and Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar are also included in the list.

265.title: India's growth, stability concerns are less than that of world: Finance Ministry
265.article_body: Estimating India's medium-term growth rate above 6%, the Finance Ministry said, the country's growth and stability concerns are less than that of the world at large. "A long-awaited domestic investment cycle that had started will accelerate once current external shocks – geopolitical conflicts and monetary tightening – fade...Corporate and bank balance sheets in India are ready for it.," it said.

266.title: Akshay shares fan's Phir Hera Pheri-inspired rangoli, says 'I love it'
266.article_body: Akshay Kumar responded to a fan who had tweeted a picture of a rangoli inspired by a scene from his film 'Phir Hera Pheri'. "Dear @akshaykumar, award winning rangoli in my office. I hope you like this," the fan wrote. Akshay responded, "Like this? I love it! Hope it brings a smile on all...visitors' faces like it did on mine."

267.title: Half of Ukraine's thermal production stations hit by Russian strikes: Min
267.article_body:
Ukrainian Energy Minister German Galushchenko said Russian air strikes have hit at least half of Ukraine's thermal generation capacity since October 10, resulting in billions of dollars in damage. 
However, not all of these thermal power plants have entirely stopped production, Galushchenko told Reuters. He further said that Ukraine may need electricity imports to get through the winter.

268.title: ICICI Bank's Q2 profit up by 37% to ₹7,558 cr as bad loan provisions fall
268.article_body: ICICI Bank posted a 37% year-on-year growth in standalone profit at ₹7,557.84 crore for the September quarter as against ₹5,511 crore in the corresponding period last year led by a fall in bad loan provisions. Its net interest income surged to ₹14,787 crore year-on-year compared to ₹11,690 crore last year. It registered a 25% year-on-year growth in retail loan portfolio.

269.title: Industrialist, wife & teenage daughter set themselves ablaze in B'luru
269.article_body: An industrialist, his wife and their teenage daughter died after allegedly setting themselves ablaze in Bengaluru's HSR Layout on Friday. The family from Kerala had shifted to Bengaluru a few years ago. Police said the industrialist, Santosh, ran a small tool manufacturing factory. Losses in business and failure to repay loans are the prime reasons behind the suicide, they added.

270.title: BJP will win more seats in Gujarat than last time: Anurag Thakur
270.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur exuded confidence that the BJP will win the upcoming Gujarat Assembly polls and said that the party will win more seats than last time. He claimed that AAP would not be able to win a single seat in the polls. "AAP has nothing. The states in which they've formed governments are in bad shape," said Thakur.

271.title: Ask your MP to quit being Dy Chairman of RS: Kishor to Bihar CM
271.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor accused Bihar CM Nitish Kumar of continuing to be in touch with the BJP. "If you have nothing to do with BJP/ NDA then ask your MP to quit the post of Deputy Chairman of Rajya Sabha," tweeted Kishor, talking about JD(U)'s Harivansh. CM Kumar had denied the allegations and said Kishor was speaking for publicity.

272.title: Pregnant woman, mother killed as ambulance hits tree in Tamil Nadu
272.article_body: A 20-year-old pregnant woman and her mother were killed after an ambulance they were in crashed into a tree in Tamil Nadu's Sivaganga district on Friday. The woman was reportedly in labour when she was travelling with her family members in the vehicle. Three other people are being treated at a hospital.

273.title: AAP Corporator Sejal Malaviya bites female security guard at Surat meeting
273.article_body: An AAP Corporator, Sejal Malaviya, reportedly bit a female security guard when she was being moved out of a meeting of the Surat Municipal Corporation's General Board in Surat. Reports said that the incident took place on Friday when BJP leader Amit Rajput tried to raise the oath issue involving Delhi's former Social Justice Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam.

274.title: Cognizant promoted 42,000 employees in FY22, spent $130 mn in hikes: Report
274.article_body: IT company Cognizant promoted around 42,000 employees in FY22 and spent $130 million (over ₹1,000 crore) in the year for merit-based and off-cycle increments, ToI reported citing an MCA filing. It also promoted 13,810 employees up to associate director levels, spending $36 million, an average increase of 14%. It also rolled out target merit assessment effective from July last year.

275.title: Texas state police fire 1st officer over Uvalde shooting which killed 19 kids
275.article_body: Texas Department of Public Safety has fired a policeman who was at the scene of the Uvalde school massacre in which 19 children and two teachers were killed. Juan Maldonado is the first state police force member to be fired in the case. A gunman armed with AR-15-style rifle went on a shooting rampage at Robb Elementary School in May.

276.title: Nigerian DJ on student visa in Pune arrested for overstay in India
276.article_body: Pune City Police has arrested the 31-year-old Nigerian DJ 'Echo Buzz' for allegedly overstaying in India. The accused had come to India on a student visa a few years ago to study at Fergusson College, police said. The DJ stayed at a housing complex in Kondhwa's Yewalewadi area and has been overstaying in the country since 2014, police added.

277.title: 978 colonies within Hyderabad ORR to receive water by March 2023
277.article_body: The work related to providing water supply to 978 colonies, located outside Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) limits and within Outer Ring Road (ORR), is set to be finished by March 2023. "While...construction of reservoirs is underway, the water distribution network will be built simultaneously so...there are no delays," Hyderabad Metropolitan Water Supply and Sewerage Board MD said.

278.title: 70,000 jobs 'oont ke muh me jeera': Surjewala on PM's Rozgar Mela
278.article_body: As PM Modi launched Rozgar Mela in which appointment letters are to be handed over to 75,000 people, the Congress called it "oont ke muh me jeera". Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said, "Modiji, you promised two crore jobs every year, which makes it 16 crore jobs in eight years...The youth want employment. Rahul Gandhi will keep raising their questions."

279.title: NZ record their biggest-ever T20 WC victory, win a match in Australia after 10 years
279.article_body: New Zealand defeated Australia by 89 runs in their first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's biggest-ever victory (by runs) in T20 World Cup history. Further, New Zealand have registered a victory in international cricket on Australian soil after more than 10 years.

280.title: A photographer jumped on car's bonnet for Aishwarya's pic, could've died: Jaya
280.article_body: Jaya Bachchan recalled how a photographer "could have died" while trying to take Aishwarya Rai's picture after her wedding in 2007. She said, "The day we were bringing Aishwarya...for 'griha pravesh', [Amitabh] was driving the car...We'd created...podium for...media, so that they could take pictures...One guy jumped on...bonnet of car...[Amitabh] lost his cool...our security took these people on."

281.title: API, constable booked for demanding bribe of ₹50,000 in Pune
281.article_body: The Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials booked an assistant police inspector (API) and a police constable in Pune for demanding a bribe of ₹50,000. The constable demanded the bribe from a 27-year-old complainant for helping by not arresting his family members in a case registered against them and the API assisted him in the crime, ACB officials said.

282.title: Taliban forces kill 6 Islamic State members in raid in Kabul
282.article_body: Taliban forces killed six Islamic State members in an overnight raid on their hideout in Afghanistan's capital, Kabul, a Taliban spokesperson said on Saturday. The slain Islamic State members were involved in two major attacks in recent weeks, one on a mosque near Kabul's former "Green Zone" and the other on a tutoring institute in the city, the spokesperson added.

283.title: Giorgia Meloni sworn in as Italy's 1st female Prime Minister
283.article_body: Giorgia Meloni was sworn in as Italy's first female Prime Minister at the presidential palace on Saturday. Meloni has been politically active since she was a teenage activist in a neo-fascist party's youth wing in Rome. In 2008, Meloni became Italy's youngest ever minister in Silvio Berlusconi's government.

284.title: Conway breaks Kohli's record for smashing highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Aus
284.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday broke Virat Kohli's record for smashing the highest T20I score by a visiting batter in Australia. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in their T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match in Sydney to break the record. Kohli had set the previous record by scoring 90*(55) against Australia in Adelaide in 2016.

285.title: Japan, Australia leaders sign new security pact amid China threat
285.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese and his Japanese counterpart Fumio Kishida on Saturday signed a new bilateral security agreement amid China's growing military presence in the Asia-Pacific region. The two countries vowed to share more sensitive intelligence and conduct joint war games. "This landmark declaration sends a strong signal to the region of our strategic alignment," Albanese said.

286.title: Ex-UK PM Boris Johnson flies back from holiday to run for office
286.article_body: Former UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson, who was on holiday in the Caribbean, has flown back to Britain to run for office for the second time. This comes as his successor, Liz Truss, stepped down after serving for 45 days. Johnson received support of dozens of Conservative lawmakers but needs to secure 100 nominations to be considered for the race.

287.title: Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO who went missing may have been killed, claims Kenyan Prez's aide
287.article_body: An aide of Kenyan President William Ruto has claimed that the two missing Indians in Kenya have been killed by the disbanded DCI unit, a report said. Balaji Telefilms' ex-COO Zulfiqar Ahmad Khan and his friend Mohamed Zaid Sami Kidwai went missing alongside taxi driver Nicodemus Mwania in July. India has been in touch with Kenyan authorities on the matter.

288.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
288.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johar took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

289.title: Video of grand laser show in Ayodhya ahead of Diwali goes viral
289.article_body: A video of a grand laser show in UP's Ayodhya ahead of Diwali has gone viral on social media. The event was organised as part of the Deepotsav celebration, which Prime Minister Narendra Modi is set to visit on Sunday. During his visit, PM Modi will also conduct an inspection of the Shri Ram Janmabhoomi Teerth Kshetra's site.

290.title: Captaining is a big thing for me: Rohit ahead of India's T20 WC opener vs Pak
290.article_body: Asked about leading India ahead of their T20 World Cup 2022 opener against Pakistan, Rohit Sharma said, "Captaining is a big thing for me, but playing any game for India is important for me." He added, "Occasions keep changing. I've played...World Cup final once, against Pakistan in 2007." The T20 World Cup is Rohit's first World Cup as captain.

291.title: 4 killed, 3 injured after jeep crashes into pole in MP's Shajapur
291.article_body: Four people were killed and three injured after their speeding jeep crashed into a pole in Madhya Pradesh's Shajapur district, said police on Saturday. Four of the victims died on the spot, while the other three were admitted to a government hospital, said a police official. A probe into the incident has been initiated, added the official.

292.title: ₹1.10 cr hawala cash found in Chevrolet Spark car in Hyd, 4 arrested
292.article_body: Hyderabad Police found hawala cash worth over ₹1.10 crore in a Chevrolet Spark car and arrested four people for possessing unaccounted money on Thursday. The main accused, Kamlesh Kumar, is a resident of Chudibazar. Police said he had hatched a plan to run hawala business in and around Hyderabad as he wasn't getting enough profit from his plastic bag business.

293.title: 6-yr-old succumbs to burn injuries after Pune hotel catches fire
293.article_body: A six-year-old girl, Iqra Naeem Khan, died in a fire accident at a hotel near Bhikardas Maruti Temple in the Sadashiv Peth area of Pune. She was shifted to a private hospital, where she succumbed to the burn injuries. The cause of the fire and the extent of the damage have not been identified so far.

294.title: Feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film: Rishab on 'Kantara'
294.article_body: Rishab Shetty in an interview thanked Kangana Ranaut for praising his film 'Kantara'. He added that it "feels nice to get praise for a rooted, regional film". "This is the story of my village...It's being loved across the globe...People are talking...about our beliefs, tradition, culture, ritual, way of life," Rishab added. Kangana had said she was "shaking" after watching 'Kantara'.

295.title: Rishi Sunak is the only man for UK PM job: Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw
295.article_body: Biocon Limited's Executive Chairperson Kiran Mazumdar-Shaw has said that Indian-origin Rishi Sunak "is the only man for the (UK) PM job". Reacting to the front page of a British newspaper that said "Could Boris (Johnson) and Rishi unite to save Tories?", the billionaire suggested that only Sunak can help the Tories in the country's economic revival and political stability.

296.title: Zelenskyy urges West to warn Russia against blowing up hydro-electric dam
296.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has urged Western countries to warn Russia against blowing up Nova Kakhovka hydro-electric dam built on the Dnipro river. "Destroying the dam would mean a large-scale disaster," Zelenskyy said, calling it a new Russian terrorist attack. Russia has accused Kyiv of planning to destroy it. Neither of the countries produced any evidence supporting their claims.

297.title: 4 members of family killed in landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli
297.article_body: Four members of a family were killed when boulders fell on several houses after a landslide in Uttarakhand's Chamoli district at around 1 am on Saturday, said officials. The deceased included two women. According to Tharali SDM, five people were trapped under debris when the boulders fell. One of them is undergoing treatment at a hospital.

298.title: Engineer who came to cut electricity in Bihar village thrashed, video surfaces
298.article_body: Locals thrashed an engineer who had come to cut the electricity supply in Bihar's Kamtaul village. A video of the incident has surfaced online. Reports said that 10 people have been booked in the case. In the video, several people can be seen beating one man brutally while others can be seen watching.

299.title: Man arrested with 215 gm of mephedrone worth ₹43 lakh in Mumbai
299.article_body: A 37-year-old man was arrested in Mumbai's Bandra for allegedly possessing 215 grams of mephedrone worth ₹43 lakh. "He (accused) is actively involved in the supply of drugs in the city. There are 17 offences registered against his name," an official said. "He has been booked under the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances Act," the official added.

300.title: Taylor Swift's 'Midnights' album release crashes Spotify
300.article_body: Thousands of users worldwide reported problems with accessing Spotify minutes after Taylor Swift released her 'Midnights' album on Friday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector. The issue reportedly got resolved within an hour. 'Midnights', which is the singer's 10th studio album, became the most-streamed album in a single day in Spotify's history, the music streaming platform tweeted.

301.title: Inflation not embedded in US economy: US Treasury Secretary Yellen
301.article_body: US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said, "I don't believe it's (inflation) becoming embedded in the US economy". She said this when asked about the recent Consumer Price Index data showing persistent increases in non-food, non-energy core inflation factors, including rents. She also said domestic investments in semiconductors and research would help increase the country's productive capacity.

302.title: Salman Khan recovering from dengue, to take a break from Bigg Boss 16: Report
302.article_body: Actor Salman Khan was diagnosed with dengue a few days ago and is currently on a break from his work commitments, as per reports. In his absence, Bigg Boss OTT host Karan Johan took over the weekend special episode of Bigg Boss 16. Salman is reportedly recovering and will soon get back to work.

303.title: History-sheeter dies hours after being shot at close range in Thane
303.article_body: A local history-sheeter, Ganesh Jadhav, succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, hours after getting wounded in a firing incident in Thane, Maharashtra. "Around 10:30 am on Friday, some men took Jadhav to a hill in Thane city, where they demanded money from him and when he refused, they fired at him from point blank range," a police official said.

304.title: Focus is on T20 WC, not worried about what's going to happen later: Rohit on Asia Cup 2023
304.article_body: Reacting to BCCI Secretary Jay Shah's remarks that India will not travel to Pakistan for Asia Cup 2023 and will seek a neutral venue, Team India captain Rohit Sharma said that the team is focussing on the ongoing T20 World Cup. He added, "We are not worried about what is going to happen later...BCCI will make the decisions on that."

305.title: 5th body found after Army helicopter crashes in Arunachal Pradesh
305.article_body: All five dead bodies have been recovered from the site where an Indian Army helicopter crashed in Arunachal Pradesh's Upper Siang on Friday. The Air Traffic Control had received a 'may day' call right before the crash, suggesting a technical or mechanical failure, the Army said. A court of inquiry has been constituted to investigate the causes of the accident.

306.title: New Zealand record their highest-ever total in T20 World Cup history
306.article_body: New Zealand registered a total of 200/3 against Australia in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match on Saturday. It is New Zealand's highest-ever total in T20 World Cup history. Their previous highest total in a T20 World Cup had come on June 11, 2009, when they scored 198/5	against Ireland.

307.title: Complete ban on firecrackers in Delhi hurtful to Hindus: RSS affiliate
307.article_body: The economic wing of the RSS, Swadeshi Jagran Manch (SJM), opposed the complete ban on firecrackers in Delhi during Diwali and called it hurtful to Hindus. "We should not forget that in Tamil Nadu (Sivakasi), West Bengal and several other parts of the country, the livelihoods of more than ten lakh people depend on the firecracker industry," said SJM's Co-convenor.

308.title: Sunak is the right person to be UK's next PM: Ex-Finance Min Javid
308.article_body: Former British Finance Minister Sajid Javid on Friday endorsed Indian-origin Rishi Sunak to be the next leader of the Conservative Party and the country's Prime Minister. "It is abundantly clear that...Sunak has what it takes to match the challenges we face, he is the right person to lead our party and take the country forward," Javid tweeted.

309.title: Russia delaying passage of ships carrying Ukrainian grains: Zelenskyy
309.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has accused Russia of deliberately delaying the passage of ships carrying Ukrainian grains, adding that 150 vessels were waiting to be loaded. Zelenskyy said that 3 million metric tonnes of grains, enough to feed 10 million people, were blocked. The grain export is a part of a Turkey-brokered deal signed between Russia and Ukraine.

310.title: GST Council issues guidelines on recurring show cause notices to taxpayers
310.article_body: The GST Council has issued guidelines on recurring show cause notices to taxpayers. The Council said only the so-called jurisdictional tax authorities must issue recurring show cause notices to those under investigation even if the initial one is issued by another authority, which could be central or state officials. The tax authorities have also implemented measures to ease taxpayers' burden.

311.title: New Zealand's Devon Conway smashes highest score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far
311.article_body: New Zealand opener Devon Conway on Saturday smashed the highest individual score of T20 World Cup 2022 so far. Conway scored 92*(58) against Australia in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match. The previous highest score of the tournament was 86(55) registered by Scotland's Michael Jones against Ireland on October 19.

312.title: 6 arrested for possessing leopard skin in Telangana's Bhupalpally
312.article_body: Six persons were arrested in Telangana's Bhupalpally for allegedly possessing leopard skin, which they were trying to sell. Two of the accused set up a trap at Pamed near the Telangana-Chhattisgarh border and killed the leopard, said police. "They were on the way to Maharashtra to sell the leopard skin for ₹30 lakh," added police.

313.title: Ghaziabad man held nearly month after he shot wife, snatched son from her
313.article_body: Ghaziabad Police have arrested a man for allegedly shooting and injuring wife and snatching their son from her nearly a month after the incident. Reports said the accused had, on September 26, gone to Ghaziabad to meet his wife and tried to take his two-year-old son. When she resisted, he allegedly shot at her and ran away with their son.

314.title: Intimate moments of couples secretly filmed in OYO rooms; 4 arrested in Noida
314.article_body: At least four people have been arrested in Noida for allegedly filming intimate moments of couples secretly in rooms of OYO hotels. The accused allegedly blackmailed the couples and threatened to leak their videos if they did not pay up, police said. They allegedly booked rooms in hotels and placed hidden cameras in the rooms before checking out, police added.

315.title: Apple will not manufacture iPhone 14 Pro Max in India: Report
315.article_body: Apple will not manufacture iPhone 14 Pro Max in India, a report said. This comes after several reports had emerged suggesting that iPhone 14 Pro Max is being manufactured in the country. Foxconn is assembling iPhone 14 at its Sriperumbudur facility near Chennai. Apple manufactures iPhone11, iPhone12 and iPhone 13 in India at the Foxconn facility.

316.title: ₹78 crore seized from 5 locations including Razorpay premises: ED
316.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has seized ₹78 crore after conducting searches at five locations including Razorpay premises in Bengaluru in Chinese loan apps case. A month ago, searches were conducted at Paytm, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments premises. "Said entities were doing their suspected/illegal business through various merchant IDs/accounts held with payment gateways/banks," agency added.

317.title: File report on commercial activities in residential areas: HC to BBMP
317.article_body: The Karnataka High Court has ordered Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) to file a comprehensive report on commercial activities being carried out in residential areas. The court has given the civic body eight weeks to do so. This comes after Wilson Garden Residents Welfare Association moved the court seeking to restrict commercial activities in their locality.

318.title: SEBI bars Bombay Dyeing, Wadias from securities market, imposes ₹13.25 crore fine
318.article_body: Markets regulator SEBI has barred Bombay Dyeing and its promoters Nusli N Wadia, Ness Wadia and Jehangir Wadia from the securities market for two years for being involved in a fraudulent scheme of misrepresenting financial statements. The regulator has imposed a total monetary penalty of ₹13.25 crore on the company and the Wadias, directing them to pay within 45 days.

319.title: Sale of European strategic infrastructures to China was an error: Macron
319.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron said the European Union has to re-think its trade dialogue with China. "We've made strategic errors in the past with the sale of infrastructures to China," Macron said at the end of a two-day EU summit on Friday. Separately, Finnish PM Sanna Marin said EU shouldn't be building strategic, critical dependency on authoritarian regimes like China.

320.title: My11Circle launches 'Har Din SUV Jito' T20 World Cup campaign
320.article_body: Fantasy cricket app My11Circle has launched 'Har Din SUV Jito' campaign featuring Saurav Ganguly. Trusted by 2.9 crore+ users, My11Circle allows users to use their cricket knowledge to create fantasy teams and win big rewards, shared the brand, adding that 100% real human players, unique app features, lower competition, and instant withdrawals make playing on My11Circle 100% safe and rewarding.

321.title: 5-year-old girl dies after over half dozen dogs attack her in MP's Khargone
321.article_body: A five-year-old girl was killed after half-a-dozen stray dogs attacked her in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone. Reports said that the girl received injuries on the neck and other parts of her body and died of excessive bleeding during treatment. The girl was going to a nearby shop to buy groceries when the incident took place.

322.title: India's forex reserves fall by $4.50 billion to $528.37 billion
322.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $4.50 billion to $528.37 billion for the week ending October 14, Reserve Bank of India data showed on Friday. The fall can be attributed to a decline in Foreign Currency Assets, which dropped $2.83 billion to $468.67 billion. In the previous week, the forex reserves had improved for the first time in 10 weeks.

323.title: Kidney patient waiting for dialysis dies as power goes off in UP hospital
323.article_body: A kidney patient who was waiting for his dialysis procedure died after power supply went off in a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Amroha. While the patient was waiting for power supply till 2 pm, his condition deteriorated, reports said. The water supply to the dialysis unit was also cut due to power disruption.

324.title: S Korea arrests ex-Defence Min over 2020 killing by North Ko­rea
324.article_body: South Korea's former Defence Minister and Coast Guard Commissioner were arrested on Saturday over their alleged involvement in a cover-up related to North Korea's killing of a South Korean fisheries official in 2020. Arrest warrants were issued for ex-Defence Minister Suh Wook and ex-Coast Guard chief Kim Hong-hee over the risks of the suspects fleeing or destroying evidence.

325.title: Rajasthan revises pay scale of 31,473 contractual workers, gram panchayat assistants
325.article_body: Rajasthan government has revised the pay scale of around 31,473 contractual workers, gram panchayat assistants, education workers and para teachers, state Education Minister BD Kalla said. "They will now get a salary of ₹18,500 after nine years of service and ₹32,000 after 18 years of service," Kalla tweeted. Congress leader Harish Chaudhary called the revision a 'Diwali gift' for people.

326.title: Raju Srivastava's wife posts unseen video of him singing Kishore Kumar song, pens note
326.article_body: Raju Srivastava's wife Shikha has shared an unseen video of the late comedian singing Kishore Kumar's 'Yaadon Main Woh Sapnon Main Hai' song. "It's been a month since you're gone but we know you're still with us and will continue to be...I didn't know you would change this song into reality so soon (in just 12 days)," she wrote.

327.title: Delhi Metro's last trains on Diwali to start at 10 pm on all lines: DMRC
327.article_body: The last train on all lines of Delhi Metro will start at 10 pm on Diwali, Delhi Metro Rail Corporation Limited (DMRC) said. "On account of Diwali, the last Metro train service on Monday will start at 10:00 pm from terminal stations of all lines," it tweeted. "Metro trains will run as usual for rest of the day," DMRC added.

328.title: RBI allows Tamilnad Mercantile Bank to open new branches after 3 yrs
328.article_body: The RBI has lifted a three-year ban on Tamilnad Mercantile Bank's branch opening with effect from October 21, the lender said on Friday. This development comes after the Thoothukudi-based bank's shares were listed on the stock exchanges on September 15. Currently, it has 509 branches, of which 106 are rural, 247 are semi-urban, 80 are urban and 76 are metropolitan.

329.title: Replace Gandhi pic with Netaji's on currency notes: Hindu Mahasabha
329.article_body: Akhil Bharat Hindu Mahasabha (ABHM) has demanded Mahatma Gandhi's photo from currency notes to be replaced with that of Netaji Subhas Chandra Bose. ABHM's Chandrachur Goswami said that it is the "best way to honour India's greatest freedom fighter Netaji". "We think Netaji's contribution to the country's freedom struggle was no less than that of Mahatma Gandhi," he added.

330.title: Extreme evil: French Prez after 12-yr-old girl murdered, body found in suitcase
330.article_body: French President Emmanuel Macron called the murder of a 12-year-old girl, whose body was found in a suitcase outside her Paris home last week, an act of "extreme evil". Macron said the family of the girl, Lola, needed "the respect and affection of the nation". A 24-year-old woman has been arrested on suspicion of murder, rape and acts of torture.

331.title: Planning to open medical college, hospital in each district: Bihar CM
331.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar announced that the government is planning to open at least one medical college and hospital in each district. He also distributed appointment letters to 9,469 health employees in Patna. "The state health society will make another 11,000 new appointments in the coming years…More than 37,400 people have been appointed in the last five years," said Kumar.

332.title: NZ break record for scoring most runs in 1st over vs Australia in T20 WC history
332.article_body: New Zealand on Saturday broke the record for scoring most runs in the first over against Australia in T20 World Cup history. New Zealand scored 14 runs off the first over in the first T20 World Cup 2022 Super 12 stage match against Australia. The over was bowled by Mitchell Starc, while New Zealand's Finn Allen aggregated all the runs.

333.title: Air India appoints Henry Donohoe as safety, security head
333.article_body: Air India has appointed Henry Donohoe as the head of its safety, security and quality functions with effect from November 7. Donohoe, an Irish national, started his career at Aer Lingus in 1978 and became its Chief Pilot. He then headed key departments including safety, quality, flight operations and engineering. He was also associated with Emirates for seven years.

334.title: MCG fines 9 people for illegally dumping garbage, 7 vehicles seized
334.article_body: To tackle the air pollution menace, the Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) increased mechanical sweeping and sprinkling of recycled water on roads and at places where construction is underway. An MCG spokesperson said that fines were issued to nine people for keeping construction material uncovered and dumping garbage illegally. The body also seized seven vehicles for carrying mixed garbage.

335.title: Deutsche Bank cuts dozens of investment banking jobs globally: Report
335.article_body: Deutsche Bank has fired dozens of employees in investment banking division globally, Bloomberg reported. The job cuts were implemented across all levels, with focus on junior ranks. The step reportedly comes in line with efforts to keep costs low. Deutsche Bank fired more than 20 junior bank employees and some senior officials based in New York, New York Post reported.

336.title: No idea why people are bashing my wife: Hetmyer who was dropped from WC over missed flight
336.article_body: After West Indies crashed out of T20 World Cup 2022, batter Shimron Hetmyer, who was dropped from the squad over missed flight, wrote on his Instagram Stories, "I have no idea why people are bashing my wife about everything that I do." He added, "I do have a mind of my own and make my own decisions and choices."

337.title: Ex-Chinese Prez sitting next to Xi escorted out of meeting; video shows him confused
337.article_body: Former Chinese President Hu Jintao, the immediate predecessor of Xi Jinping, on Saturday was unexpectedly escorted out of the closing ceremony of a congress of the ruling Communist Party. The 79-year-old, who was seated next to Xi, was led off the stage by two men. The video of the incident shows Hu appearing to be confused while being escorted out.

338.title: PM Modi launches 'Rozgar Mela'; 75,000 youths get appointment letters
338.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Saturday launched 'Rozgar Mela', the recruitment drive for 10 lakh youths, via video conferencing. Appointment letters to more than 75,000 youths were handed over during the ceremony. "As per the PM's directions, all ministries and departments are working towards filling up existing vacancies against sanctioned posts in 'mission mode'," the official press release said.

339.title: Side effects of biggest crisis in 100 years can't just go away in 100 days: PM Modi
339.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said, "The side effects of the biggest crisis in 100 years can't just go away in 100 days." Addressing the 'Rozgar Mela', he noted that many big economies of the world are struggling with inflation and unemployment. "Despite this, India has been trying to save itself from global crisis by taking new initiatives and risks," he added.

340.title: Software engineer out on bike ride gang-raped by 10 in Jharkhand; boyfriend beaten
340.article_body: A 26-year-old software engineer was allegedly gang-raped by around 10 men in Jharkhand's West Singhbhum district, police said. The woman was out with her boyfriend on a bike on Thursday when the incident took place. The men thrashed her boyfriend and allegedly gang-raped her after taking her to a secluded area, police told PTI.

341.title: Elephant electrocuted to death in Assam, toll rises
341.article_body: An elephant was electrocuted to death after coming in contact with a live electric wire near the Napuk tea estate in the Charaideo district of Assam on Friday, said forest officials. Multiple elephant deaths have been reported in the state over the last few weeks. Earlier this month, an elephant died from electrocution in the Kokrajhar district.

342.title: Donald Trump summoned to testify before panel probing US Capitol riots
342.article_body: The House Select Committee investigating the US Capitol riots has summoned former US President Donald Trump, ordering him to testify under oath. Trump has been asked to produce documents detailing his communications before the riots. "We have assembled overwhelming evidence...that you personally orchestrated and oversaw...effort to overturn the 2020 presidential election," Committee told Trump.

343.title: 12-yr-old boy out to get chapatis for dad killed as BEST bus crushes him
343.article_body: A 12-year-old boy was killed after a Brihanmumbai Electric Supply & Transport Undertaking bus crushed him in Mumbai. Reports said that the boy was out to buy chapatis from a nearby hotel for his father when the incident took place. Reports added that the driver could not stop the vehicle in time and crushed the boy.

344.title: PM Modi announces ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for families of deceased in Rewa accident
344.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakhs from Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) for the families of those who were killed in the bus accident in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. PMO said that those injured in the accident would be given ₹50,000. As many as 15 people were killed in the incident while 40 others were injured.

345.title: US woman stabbed & buried alive by ex-husband, survives by using nose to remove soil
345.article_body: A 42-year-old woman who was allegedly stabbed and buried alive by former husband in US' Washington managed to survive by wiggling her nose in the soil to create pockets of space that allowed her to breathe, she said. The man has been arrested and charged with attempted murder, domestic violence/first-degree assault and kidnapping. The woman was rushed to a hospital.

346.title: ₹1,457 crore paid by Google India to its Ireland arm is not royalty, rules ITAT
346.article_body: The Bengaluru-bench of Income Tax Appellate Tribunal (ITAT) ruled that payments totalling ₹1,457 crore made by Google India to Google Ireland is not a royalty and therefore, it is not subject to withholding tax. In its earlier order, the ITAT held that payments made by Google India between 2007-08 and 2012-13 are royalty and tax should be paid in India.

347.title: Facebook threatens to stop news sharing in Canada over revenue-sharing bill
347.article_body: Facebook has warned that it may block news sharing on its platform in Canada at a time when a legislation that compels digital platforms to pay news publishers for their content is under consideration. "The Online News Act misrepresents the relationship between platforms and news publishers," a Meta Canada official said. Facebook has not been invited to share its concerns.

348.title: Myanmar put on terror financing watchdog FATF's 'black list'
348.article_body: Global money laundering and terror financing watchdog Financial Action Task Force (FATF) has 'blacklisted' Myanmar for "continued lack of progress" by the military junta. The watchdog also called on member countries to apply enhanced due diligence to business relations and transactions in Myanmar. The FATF "black list" consists of just two other countries, Iran and North Korea.

349.title: Jio's Q2 net profit rises by 28% to ₹4,518 cr, revenue up 20%
349.article_body: Reliance Jio posted a 28% rise in net profit to ₹4,518 crore during the September quarter and on a sequential basis, the profit grew by 4%.
