Its revenue was reported at ₹22,521 crore, a 20% year-on-year increase. Sequentially, revenue increased by 3%. The average revenue per user (ARPU) at ₹177.2 per subscriber per month witnessed a 23.5% growth.

350.title: I am not playing WC, team has already left: Dhoni on cricket-related question at an event
350.article_body: A video has gone viral showing an interaction between an anchor and former India captain MS Dhoni at an event. The anchor can be heard saying, "If I don't ask you a World Cup question, [the audience] are gonna lynch me", to which Dhoni responds, "I'm not playing the World Cup...The team has already left."

351.title: Langur attends funeral of man who used to feed it, tries to wake him up; video viral
351.article_body: A video showing a langur attending the funeral of a man who used to feed it has gone viral on social media. In the video, the langur can be seen sitting near the body of the man and trying to wake him up. Several users who shared the clip said it has been shot in Sri Lanka's Batticaloa.

352.title: Vodafone Idea to issue ₹1,600 cr debentures to ATC Telecom to repay dues
352.article_body: The cash-strapped Vodafone Idea's (Vi) board on Friday approved the issuance of debentures worth ₹1,600 crore to ATC Telecom Infrastructure Private Limited. The telco will use the funds to repay dues to ATC Telecom, which stand at less than ₹2,000 crore. Vi said any funds remaining will be used for the company's "general corporate purposes".

353.title: Fire breaks out during refilling petroleum depot in Bhopal, 7 injured
353.article_body: A massive fire broke out during refilling at a petroleum depot in the Bakaniya area in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal, police said. As many as seven people were injured in the incident, police added. "All the injured persons have been admitted to a nearby private hospital," DCP Bhopal Vijay Khatri said. "Of those injured, four are in critical condition," Khatri added.

354.title: Airtel announces the launch of Airtel 5G Plus
354.article_body: Airtel has launched Airtel 5G Plus in a phased manner in Delhi, Mumbai, Chennai, Bengaluru, Hyderabad, Siliguri, Nagpur and Varanasi. It shared that customers can check if their area/ smartphone is 5G-enabled via Airtel Thanks App, adding that Airtel customers can switch to Airtel 5G Plus on their existing Airtel 4G SIMs.

355.title: Chemist, electrician returning from Chandigarh shop die as SUV hits scooter
355.article_body: A 35-year-old chemist, Suresh Kumar, and a 50-year-old electrician, Mahesh Chand, were killed after an SUV hit the scooter that they were travelling on in Chandigarh. The driver of the SUV has been arrested. The deceased were returning from Suresh's shop. Reports quoted sources as saying that the driver of the SUV was drunk.

356.title: AIMIM organises biryani fests in Madhya Pradesh to strengthen party
356.article_body: Ahead of the Madhya Pradesh Assembly elections in 2023, AIMIM launched its campaign by organising biryani fests to strengthen the party in the state. "Our [plan] is to make more than 10 lakh members of AIMIM before the Assembly elections. People are coming to Owaisi with enthusiasm...Hyderabadi Biryani is very famous after Owaisi in India," said AIMIM leader Peerzada Nizami.

357.title: Indian-origin man charged for killing his 11-yr-old son, 13-yr-old daughter in Canada
357.article_body: A 45-year-old Indian-origin Canadian man, Kamaljit Arora, has been charged with two counts of first-degree murder after his 11-year-old son and 13-year-old daughter were killed in their home in Montreal. He's also charged with one count of assault causing bodily harm for allegedly strangling his wife. Their neighbour said that the kids' elder sister had notified the police.

358.title: Viraj Ghelani orders pataka online, ends up getting Pataka Wraps: Faasos
358.article_body: Faasos shared that this Diwali, patakas aren't the only thing trending as its quirky activation idea got the netizens talking about its #PatakaWraps: Diwali-special wrap collection. Instagrammers like Viraj Ghelani, Nayandeep Rakshit posted about how their pataka order turned out to be exclusive bomb-tasting wraps, Faasos said, adding that the collection features some of its most loved wraps.

359.title: Delhi valet parking worker says i20 ran over feet, policeman's daughter booked
359.article_body: The Delhi Assistant Commissioner of Police's daughter has been booked after a valet parking assistant said that she ran over his feet with a car at a mall in Saket. "An i20...ran over my feet. My colleagues rushed me to hospital...I did not file the complaint earlier as I was waiting for my family members," victim said in an FIR.

360.title: MobiKwik's loss widens to ₹128 cr in FY22, revenue up 82%: Report
360.article_body: MobiKwik's parent company One MobiKwik Systems' consolidated revenue jumped 82.5% to ₹526.5 crore, while its consolidated loss was ₹128 crore in FY22 as compared to ₹111 crore a year ago, Moneycontrol reported citing regulatory filings. Total income jumped 80% to ₹543 crore and total expenses increased 61% to ₹652.5 crore. MobiKwik attained unicorn status in October 2021.

361.title: 'Red light on, Gaadi off' campaign from Oct 28 as Delhi AQI worsens
361.article_body: In a bid to curb vehicular pollution, the Delhi government will start its 'Red Light on, Gaadi off' campaign from October 28, said Environment Minister Gopal Rai. The city's Air Quality Index (AQI) on Friday plunged to 262, which falls in the 'poor' category. Experts believe toxic smog levels could increase after Diwali if the wind direction changes, added Rai.

362.title: UK Defence Secy opts out of PM race, suggests he would back Johnson
362.article_body: British Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Friday said he would not stand in the contest to replace Liz Truss as Prime Minister. "I feel that I can add the best value in keeping people safe at defence, by being the Defence Secretary," he added. Wallace also said he is "leaning towards" backing ex-PM Boris Johnson in the Tory leadership race.

363.title: Bengal teen kills self in police station after boy refuses to marry
363.article_body: An 18-year-old woman allegedly killed herself in the toilet of a police station in West Bengal's Uttar Dinajpur after a 17-year-old boy refused to marry her. "The two were reportedly in a relationship for six months," said an officer. The incident occurred after the woman created a ruckus outside the boy's house on Thursday. The boy was taken into custody.

364.title: No fine for violating traffic rules in Gujarat till Oct 27; violators to get flowers
364.article_body: Gujarat Home Minister Harsh Sanghavi has announced that no fine will be levied for traffic rule violations in the state from October 21 to 27 due to the festival of Diwali. "Don't use the decision to break the law. If someone breaks the rules, the Gujarat Police will persuade them not to, by giving flowers," he said in a video.

365.title: Woman claims L'Oreal hair products caused cancer, sues company in US
365.article_body: A woman in US has sued L'Oreal after claiming that she contracted uterine cancer after using chemical hair straightening products sold by L'Oreal USA. She said she had used the products for over two decades before being diagnosed and undergoing a full hysterectomy. This comes after a study established a link between usage of hair straightening products and uterine cancer.

366.title: SBI hikes interest rates on select fixed deposits by up to 80 bps
366.article_body: State Bank of India (SBI) hiked interest rates on select fixed deposit (FD) tenures by up to 80 basis points. The new rates, which come into effect from October 22, will be applicable for FDs of less than ₹2 crore. The announcement comes days after SBI hiked the savings deposit rates by 30 bps for large accounts on October 18.

367.title: ﻿Synapsica﻿ fires 30% staff a month after CEO, COO arrested in ₹16-cr fraud case
367.article_body: Synapsica, a healthtech startup backed by Y Combinator, has laid off nearly 30% of its employees as part of a restructuring move, Co-founder Kuldeep Singh Chauhan confirmed. The layoffs come a month after the arrests of the company's CEO Meenakshi Singh and COO Dr Cherian. The siblings were arrested for allegedly duping Synapsica Co-founder Gandharv Goyal of around ₹16 crore.

368.title: US protects Ethiopian immigrants from deportation amid civil war
368.article_body: Citing the civil war in Ethiopia, the US on Friday announced that Ethiopians living in the country will get work permits and be shielded from deportation for 18 months. US Homeland Security Department said it was extending Temporary Protected Status to Ethiopians due to the "extraordinary and temporary conditions" that make it dangerous for them to return to their country.

369.title: 10 held for selling fake platelets as man dies after wrong platelets transfusion in UP
369.article_body: Ten gang members were arrested for allegedly selling fake platelets to patients in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. Police said the accused used to take plasma from different blood banks and put it in pouches. The action came after a man died after wrong platelets transfusion on October 17. His family claimed that the platelet was thin and made of mosambi juice.

370.title: Central Railway hikes platform ticket fare to ₹50 till Oct-end in Mumbai
370.article_body: Central Railway of Mumbai Division increased the price of platform tickets from ₹10 to ₹50 from Friday till October-end. The increased fare will be enforced only at Chhatrapati Shivaji Terminus, Dadar, Thane, Kalyan, Lokmanya Tilak Terminus and Panvel stations, an official said. The decision was taken to curb the excessive rush of passengers amid the festive Diwali season.

371.title: India reports 2,112 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 24,043
371.article_body: India reported 2,112 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,119 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 24,043. The COVID-19 death toll so far has reached 5,28,957 following four casualties in the last 24 hours.

372.title: Noida Police arrests 2 for extortion by filming couple's hotel stay
372.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for trying to extort money from a couple by recording videos of their stay at a hotel, said Noida Police. According to police, the accused stayed in the same hotel room a few days ago and installed a camera there. The police said the couple received their videos and were asked to pay money.

373.title: MCD allocates ₹40,000 per ward to increase street lights at Chhath ghats
373.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has allocated ₹40,000 per ward to increase street lighting facilities at around 500 Chhath ghats in the national capital. "The funds will be provided for two ghats per ward. The amount will be utilised for strengthening street lighting in and around Chhath Puja ghats," a corporation spokesperson said.

374.title: Advisory issued against scammers and 5G fraud in Maharashtra
374.article_body: The Maharashtra Police have recently issued an advisory against a new wave of scammers and they believe that the fraudsters might try to cheat citizens on the pretext of providing 5G services. "Citizens are being warned not to fall prey to such calls and messages and we appeal to them not to share their details," said the advisory.

375.title: Viral video shows groom wearing gigantic garland of notes in Pak; people call him 'UFO'
375.article_body: A video showing a groom wearing a gigantic garland of currency notes in Pakistan has gone viral on social media. Reacting to the video, social media users wrote, "He looks like UFO," and, "This looks like a bed cover." Many users called it a "show off", with one saying, "I'd rather have it in an envelope."

376.title: 2 arrested for attacking Hyd petrol pump, scaring staff with toy gun
376.article_body: Two persons have been arrested for allegedly attacking a petrol pump in Hyderabad on October 17. The accused reportedly used a toy gun and a knife to scare the staff and broke the window and furniture of the petrol pump's office. They are also said to have hurt the employees and the owner of the petrol pump.

377.title: Mumbai twins cured of thalassemia as 9-yr-old brother donates bone marrow
377.article_body: Swarali and Swaranjali, 12-year-old twin sisters, who were suffering from thalassemia, have been cured of the blood disorder after their nine-year-old brother, Raj Jadhav, donated his bone marrow for their treatment. "I...told him it would be very painful. It took us six months to arrange funds for the transplants and prepare him mentally," said their father.

378.title: White House in talks with Musk to set up Starlink in Iran: Report
378.article_body: The White House is in talks with SpaceX CEO Elon Musk about setting up his company's satellite internet service Starlink in Iran, CNN reported citing multiple officials. Iran imposed internet restrictions after death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in police custody last month sparked nationwide protests. The US Treasury Department earlier eased some sanctions to help Iranians access internet.

379.title: Reliance to demerge financial services business, list it on stock exchanges
379.article_body: Reliance Industries has announced the demerger of its financial services business into a separate entity and the subsequent listing of the same on stock exchanges. The Mukesh Ambani-led company will demerge Reliance Strategic Investments and the resulting entity will be named Jio Financial Services. This will be done through a share-swap arrangement and no cash will be involved, Reliance said.

380.title: Apple's top hardware designer to leave 3 years after replacing Jony Ive
380.article_body: Apple's VP of industrial design Evans Hankey will leave the company after being in the role for three years. She took over the role in 2019 after the departure of Jony Ive, Apple's former design chief who worked with the company for two decades. Hankey will reportedly remain at Apple for the next six months to help with the transition.

381.title: Notice sent to medical college after video of girl dancing & rapping goes viral in Pakistan
381.article_body: A notice was issued to a medical college in Pakistan's Peshawar after a video of a girl rapping and dancing on stage during an event went viral on social media. The letter called the incident "unethical and immoral". "You are therefore directed to explain your position within three days positively, otherwise strict disciplinary action will be initiated," the letter stated.

382.title: Moody's lowers UK's outlook to 'negative' over political turmoil
382.article_body: Rating agency Moody's, on Friday, lowered the UK's outlook to 'negative' from 'stable' over the ongoing political turmoil following PM Liz Truss' resignation on Thursday. Moody's maintained its sovereign rating at 'Aa3' and said there was "heightened unpredictability in policymaking amid weaker growth prospects and high inflation". It also said there were "risks to the UK's debt affordability".

383.title: Russia not interested in ending Ukraine aggression: US
383.article_body: US State Secretary Antony Blinken said there is no evidence at the moment that Russia is "actually interested in stopping the [Ukraine] aggression". "On the contrary, we see Russia...tripling down on its aggression: in the last month, the mobilisation of hundreds of thousands of Russians; horrifically, cannon fodder that [Vladimir] Putin is trying to throw into the war," he added.

384.title: PCMC stays move over waste collection from big societies from Nov 1
384.article_body: Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) on Friday stayed its decision not to collect wet waste from big housing societies from November 1. "At the same time, we will continue to hold positive engagement to convince them about processing the wet waste at their premises under the Solid Waste Management Rules, 2016," Municipal Commissioner Shekhar Singh said.

385.title: Delhi Police arrests 2 absconders evading arrest for 24 years from Bihar
385.article_body: Delhi Police arrested two men who had been evading arrest for 24 years in connection with a murder case from Bihar. "Our team...was regularly working to nab these proclaimed offenders. On Thursday, secret input was received about them," DCP (South) Chandan Choudhary said. One of the accused was absconding after his release on court bail in 1999.

386.title: Mumbai woman looking to buy appliances via Facebook ad cheated of ₹2.07 lakh
386.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was cheated of ₹2.07 lakh after being promised air conditioner and washing machine through Facebook advertisement. The man, who claimed to be a Navy official said he would sell the appliances to her for ₹15,000. However, three men cheated her of ₹2.07 lakh under pretext of failed transactions. She was even asked for money for airport clearance.

387.title: 12 flyers injured, suffer broken nose as turbulence hits Spain flight; pic surfaces
387.article_body: Twelve passengers were injured after an Aerolíneas Argentinas flight from Spain to Argentina carrying 271 people was hit by severe turbulence, the airline said. A passenger is said to have suffered a broken nose, while a picture showed a passenger on a wheelchair with head injury. The airline said that three passengers were moved to a hospital.

388.title: ED seizes ₹78 crore during raids in B'luru in Chinese loan apps case
388.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate conducted raids at five locations in Bengaluru in the Chinese loan apps case and seized ₹78 crore. It also searched premises of payment gateway Razorpay, a spokesperson of which said the company cooperated with the agency and its funds were not seized. These apps are operated by Chinese nationals using forged documents of Indians, said the ED.

389.title: Rishi Sunak qualifies for UK PM race, 1st to get support of over 100 MPs
389.article_body: British Conservative politician Rishi Sunak has reached the minimum nomination threshold to enter the race to be the next party leader and Prime Minister. The ex-Finance Minister is the first contender to receive support of at least 100 Tory MPs. Sunak will automatically become party leader and Prime Minister if others fail to win 100 nominations from fellow Tory MPs.

390.title: Hyderabad Metro bans travelling with firecrackers ahead of Diwali
390.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Rail Limited (HMRL) has prohibited its passengers from travelling with firecrackers ahead of Diwali. It has put up posters at various stations for it. According to officials, carrying such objects could endanger the safety of everyone using the metro system, including the staff and the public. Violators won't be allowed to ride the train, said officials.

391.title: India reacts after Pakistan removed from terror financing watchdog's grey list
391.article_body: After Pakistan was removed from global terror finance watchdog FATF's grey list, India said, "As a result of FATF scrutiny, Pakistan has been forced to take some action against well-known terrorists." "It is in global interest that the world remains clear that Pakistan must continue to take credible, verifiable, irreversible and sustained action against terrorism," India further said.

392.title: When and at what time will India's T20 World Cup 2022 matches take place?
392.article_body: India will face Pakistan in their first T20 World Cup 2022 match on October 23. India will face Netherlands, South Africa, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe on October 27, 30, November 2 and 6, respectively. India's matches against Pakistan, Bangladesh and Zimbabwe will begin at 1.30 pm. India's matches against Netherlands and SA will begin at 12.30 pm and 4.30 pm, respectively.

393.title: 14 killed, 40 injured as bus travelling from Hyd to UP collides with trolley in MP
393.article_body: As many as 14 persons were killed and 40 others were injured in a collision between a bus and trolley near Suhagi Pahari in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa, police said. "Of the 40 injured, 20 (have been) admitted to a hospital in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj," Rewa SP Navneet Bhasin said. "Bus was going from Hyderabad to Gorakhpur," Bhasin added.

394.title: JugJugg Jeeyo premieres tonight, 8 pm on Colors Cineplex
394.article_body: JugJugg Jeeyo, one of the year's most successful movies as per Bollywood Hungama, will have its world television premiere on Colors Cineplex. The movie boasts a stellar star cast including Anil Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor, Varun Dhawan, Kiara Advani, Prajakta Koli, and Maniesh Paul who come together to make your Diwali more 'lit' on Colors Cineplex, said the brand.

395.title: Viraj Ghelani orders pataka online, ends up getting Pataka Wraps: Faasos
395.article_body: Faasos shared that this Diwali, patakas aren't the only thing trending as its quirky activation idea got the netizens talking about its #PatakaWraps: Diwali-special wrap collection. Instagrammers like Viraj Ghelani, Nayandeep Rakshit posted about how their pataka order turned out to be exclusive bomb-tasting wraps, Faasos said, adding that the collection features some of its most loved wraps.

396.title: Tamil Nadu logs 222 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths in 24 hours
396.article_body: Tamil Nadu recorded 222 fresh cases of COVID-19 in the last 24 hours, the State Health Department informed on Friday. No new deaths due to the infection were reported in the state. Tamil Nadu's active case count stood at 3,504, according to the daily COVID-19 bulletin. Chennai logged 55 new cases, the highest among all districts in the state.

397.title: UN Security Council approves sanctions against Haitian gang leader
397.article_body: UN Security Council on Friday unanimously passed a sanctions resolution targeting Haitian gang leader Jimmy Cherizier. It also established a committee that can impose sanctions on other Haitians and groups whose actions threaten Haiti's peace and stability. The sanctions regime will allow the UN to impose an asset freeze, travel ban and arms embargo against anyone supporting criminal activities.

398.title: Anurag Thakur breaks down while addressing BJP workers in Himachal
398.article_body: Sports Minister Anurag Thakur broke down on Friday while addressing BJP workers at an election meeting in Sujanpur, Himachal Pradesh. He got emotional while talking about the support he has received from the people of his hometown, Hamirpur. The BJP leader also recalled his father ex-CM Prem Kumar Dhumal's interactions with workers. A video showed Thakur constantly wiping his eyes.

399.title: Outstanding from Zimbabwe in their return to World Cup action: Bishop
399.article_body: Ian Bishop praised Zimbabwe after the team reached their maiden Super 12 stage in T20 World Cup on Friday. "Outstanding from Zimbabwe in their return to World Cup action. Bowling group was outstanding. And once again Sikandar Raza getting just rewards for an outstanding year," tweeted Bishop. Zimbabwe beat Scotland by five wickets in their final Group B match.

400.title: Italy's Giorgia Meloni formally asks Prez for mandate to govern
400.article_body: Italian politician Giorgia Meloni on Friday said she and her allies have asked President Sergio Mattarella to give her the mandate to form Italy's next government. On the day, Meloni and her allies met Mattarella at the Quirinal presidential palace. Later, the palace said that Mattarella had summoned Meloni back to meet him in the afternoon on Friday.

401.title: Funeral organised for monkeys who died due to electrocution in Bihar
401.article_body: Locals on Thursday organised a funeral for two monkeys who died due to electrocution after being hit by a high-tension wire near a Hanuman temple in Bihar's Gaya. The funeral procession was reportedly taken out from the temple following several Hindu rituals, amid the beating of drums. The monkeys were cremated at a crematorium on the banks of Falgu river.

402.title: Indian duo of Rankireddy-Shetty crashes out of Denmark Open 2022
402.article_body: Indian men's doubles pair of Satwiksairaj Rankireddy and Chirag Shetty crashed out of the Denmark Open 2022 on Friday. The seventh seeds, who won the Commonwealth Games 2022 men's doubles gold medal, lost to world champions Aaron Chia and Soh Wooi Yik 16-21, 19-21 in the quarter-final. Rankireddy and Shetty lost the match in 41 minutes.
